description: I have been coming here for years. Kathy is simply the best! It you get a chance to order from her kitchen consider yourself lucky. One of the best in the area (better than Slanted Door, better than Pho 84, and better than Le Cheval and Dragon Rouge). For vegetarians I recommend the Pho like soup with all veggie broth. It is light, aromatic, herbaceous - - light and filling at the same time, a yummy broth. The ban xao is crispy and fresh. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!
author: Penny B.

description:
I don't like to give low or bad reviews but I cannot get myself to give this place anymore than a 3. I mean a 3 isn't that bad but it isn't that good either.

After a weekend of traveling, I got back late and wanted some comfort Vietnamese food. So, I ordered for takeout delivery. I ordered shrimp and pork rolls, chicken salad, and catfish hot and sour soup which is canh cua in Vietnamese. I knew their catfish hot and sour soup won't fully taste like homecooked traditional soup but I was still hopeful. 

When I got my order, I was so excited to cave in and just eat. It was a pretty cold evening so I started with the soup. I took a sip of the soup and could not finish the rest. I hate to bash but this is just my personal experience, the soup had a powerful fish smell. The catfish fillet didn't taste fresh. It tasted like they threw it together last minute. I didn't mind average tasting soup but this was below average to me.

The shrimp and pork spring rolls were good. They were normal. I don't expect restaurants to go wrong with spring rolls. 

The chicken salad was decent. It was chicken with cabbage salad with a fish sauce based vinaigrette. Though it was fish sauce based but it was light and not overpowering. It tasted good when tossed in the salad.

Overall, the food was average. I think, for the most part, I'll stay away from the traditional home type of soup here. I don't know if I'll come back or order again but it was just a mediocre experience for me.
author: Ngoc P.

description: I never really write reviews but I want to warn people of my experience. I'm giving 3 stars only because they were quick. 10 min for my food. I see why...there was hardly anything in my order. Overpriced and mediocre. $15 including tax for noodles that were all stuck together. They were overcooked and became a big blob of noodles all stuck together. Only 5 pieces of small prawns and barely any veggies. It was my first and last time for me to visit.
author: Jasmin P.

description:
If you're in the mood for Bun Cha in Bernal, this will hit the spot!  Good food, great service, and a pleasant setting.

My husband and I both got the bun Cha: the BBQ pork with imperial rolls and rice noodles.  The meat and imperial rolls were delicious, and the entire dish tasted fresh and flavorful!

The waiter, an older gentleman, was very friendly and polite, which we appreciated!  The food came out quickly.

The restaurant is clean, spacious, and simply decorated.

Overall, a good spot for Vietnamese food in Bernal!  We look forward to returning.
author: Barnali D.

description: The owner can be heard aggressively yelling at a worker from the kitchen while you are seated in the dining room. Minutes after, the worker is in the dining room prepping and you hear the owner come out and continue to degrade the worker. There are many restaurants in this neighborhood and Lotus Garden should not be in business for their run-of-the-mill food and concerning treatment of workers.
author: Win N.

description:
I've only ordered from here once but everything was so good.  The best part after the food was that I had every piece I needed to put together the meal including instructions written on the box, down to every piece of lettuce, sauce, lime slice.  Absolutely phenomenal.  

Def ordering from here again
author: A K.

description: In spite of mixed reviews, I decided against traveling farther on a rainy day. The food was decent, but the policies didn't sit well with me. $18 minimum for credit cards and $1.5/person for weak-a$$ tea. I will refrain from patronizing again.
author: Kenneth L.

description:
My experience here is pretty consistent with other reviews. The food and service is fine. I've had the pho ga and pho tai and they satisfied the craving. But the main reason to come here is it's close to my house. 

Their credit card policy is weird - $18 minimum. I guess at least they're up front about it - the guy announced it to me when I walked in and nobody else was there. Can't imagine that's helping to bring in customers.
author: Dan P.

description: As far as I'm concerned there's no reason to come here, since there are so many restaurants in this neighborhood that are actually good. Service: F. We came in the middle of the day when the restaurant was basically empty, but the waiter still managed to be rude. He just didn't seem like he wanted us to be there. He tried to get me to order something besides what I wanted, he walked off in the middle of my order when another customer came in the door, and he waved me off when I asked for the bill. Food: F. I ordered 5 spice chicken with rice and I ended up just eating rice because the chicken was too fatty with no flavor. Ambiance: D. The radio was playing loudly over the speakers and we were stuck listening to commercials. Actually, this was the best part about the meal...
author: Greg F.

description: Came in on an empty night and they told us we had to spend a minimum of $10 each so we left. I have never heard any restaurant doing that, especially on such a dead night. We won't be back.
author: Josie L.

description: The only Vietnamese restaurant in the Bernal Heights neighborhood so don't expect much. You should eat Vietnamese food in the Tenderloin or San Jose instead where Vietnamese food is plentiful. The food was alright but pricier than most places I've been to. The service is also not that great. My colleague ordered tea and they wanted to also charge me if I drink some from the teapot, This is ridiculous as my co-worker obviously isn't going to be able to finish drinking all of the tea in that teapot, but they wanted to charge for an extra cup. All Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in the Tenderloin and Chinatown always gave me FREE tea. My other co-worker likes this place cause they have vegetarian pho. A movie I watched about Vietnam said authentic pho soup is always made from meat bone, so I guess they altered it in order to make vegetarian pho...
author: Jennifer T.

description: I live half  block away. This place sucks and is very overpriced even for Bernal Heights. All dishes look and tastes the same whether its pork chicken beef or sea food.  same same same. Same vegies same gravies. Went on my birthday and owner was very rude when my brother and his son ordered dishes but did not want onions or peppers in it....she started to argue and said she would have to see if cook wants to do that and if so there would be an extra charge for special order. For leaving vegies out? She never came back and brought our food after we drank our sodas and viet coffees and waited 35 min at 2pm on a Sun afternoon without anyone in the place when we came in or left, Stay away...just go by and see how many people are in there. I pass there everyday and don't even see people going for takeout even tho' they have overpriced viet sandwiches to go only.
author: Jerold D.

description: This review is for service only. I haven't eaten here because I tried to order pick up and pay with a credit card, only to be informed that they have an $18 minimum. Not winning any customers over here.
author: Sarah T.

description: Our favorite Vietnamese restaurant!  Delicious food, good service! We loved the garlic noodles, lemon grass chicken, and coconut curry chicken! Can't wait to come back!
author: N J.

description:
Fried spring rolls = A+ although the portion size is rather small, you only get like 2 cut up spring rolls. 

Came here specifically for the vegan pho.  Broth was tasty, however overall was not impressed - I've had better and worse else where.  This lies somewhere in the middle of the scale. 

Not bad if this is the only thing near you.
author: Christina L.

description: the pork chops (dinner portion) are the best in the city!  A huge portion and cooked perfectly, a little fat on the edges, the fat a little crisp. It's all you need.
author: M A.

description:
Lotus Garden was overpriced, small portions and mediocre food.  

The crepe, which for some reason is a hard dish to find even though it's a cheap, relatively easy item to make, was small and pretty bland.  I was disappointed because I had talked this dish up to my friend and then it wasn't very good.  

The shaking beef was really flavorful and delicious but it was served with sautéed onions on top of a bed of chopped up lettuce.  It was really odd because the lettuce was too small to wrap the beef with so it seemed like you were supposed to eat it like a salad, even though the beef was hot.  In an order, which is like $13, you get probably ¼ pound of meat, ¼ pound of onions and a bunch of lettuce.  If they doubled the beef, I would recommend this dish.  

The shrimp fried rice was OK, but it tasted like the char from the wok had been scraped into the rice.  They need to throw some salt in that walk and scrub it.  They also cut the shrimp in half lengthwise, obviously to make it appear more plentiful in the dish, so you get like 3 small-medium shrimp (6 halves) and they are dried out from being cut so thin. 

Those three small, lackluster dishes and two sodas ran about $44.
author: Emma H.

description: I FOUND A PIECE OF METAL IN MY SOUP. WARNING! literally you do NOT want to come here. i'd give this place a 0 star if i could. it ruined my appetite 100%.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Walked in on a gloomy afternoon for some Vietnamese comfort food and Lotus Garden did not disappoint. 

A clean restaurant was a good first impression followed by friendly service from the owner. Her son was doing homework in a corner - definitely a family-owned business kind of feel. 

We started out with the imperial rolls and they were crispy and flavorful with a nice balance of shrimp and pork to veggies. I had the special beef noodle soup which is essentially a combo if you will. The broth was light, and while not the most complex that I've had, it more than did its job to warm me right back up. Fairly decent portion sizes for the price and I left feeling pretty full. 

Bumped Lotus Garden up a notch a little because the service was really personal. Not often in this part of town too much but wouldn't mind coming back if I am.
author: Jon L.

description: It's OK. We usually only order for delivery because they are close by and pretty fast. But don't you dare asking for extra fish sauce or anything else to your order otherwise the lady on the phone will just yell at you and say no. Or charge you $2 bucks for a little thing of sauce. Pray that the man answers the phone if you're calling in.
author: Julia M.

description:
When I first moved into the hood I came here excited there is a place to get pho so close to me, and I thought it was okay. I honestly don't remember what my issue was, I think I just had very high expectations.

Today, again I was craving pho and I was starving, so I thought I'd give it a try again. And you know what, it was pretty good. Was it the best pho I ever had? No. But this is the only Vietnamese restaurant around. Remember people, we are in Bernal Heights here. It's not a pho destination. There is no travel book that says Bernal Heights THE place to get pho. We are not in the tenderloin. We are not in Little Saigon in San Jose. 

No one is saying, "Awww man, I'm going to Bernal Heights to get me some amazing Vietnamese food." 

No one says that.

Now, tacos and pupusas? Yeah I'm going to judge it pretty harshly in Bernal. This is where you go to get it so it better be good. 

Given this is the only Vietnamese food in the neighborhood, it's not bad. Broth was flavorful enough. Meat was good. Nice chunks of tendon. Strong Viet iced coffee.

Some had complained about the portions on the Yelp. Given in SF you can go get a bowl of ramen that ends up being like... $15, $8.95 for a bowl of pho in SF in a gentrifying neighborhood is not bad. The portion was perfect for me, but maybe for a lumberjack who had a hard day chopping wood (very plausible in San Francisco.... JK JK), then yeah, maybe it's small. Perhaps the restaurant should think of having multiple sizes for people to choose. 

So next time I'm in the mood for pho and don't feel like going for "destination pho", I will definitely be back.
author: Bonnie H.

description:
Visiting the Bay Area for the day and stopped at this place for some Pho.  The place was on a street filled with other restaurants, parking might be a challenge.  The place was empty when we went in so it was a little concerning, but that soon change as customer started to flow in, still not as busy as others.  

The Thai tea was definitely good.  Ordered the Pho and had to wait a good 10 minutes to actually get it.  The meats were still pink when served so that's great.  The other meatball and tendons were a tad chewy, perhaps they were not cooked long enough.  The broth was a little bland, but good enough.  I certainly had better tasting broth than this place.  The staff are friendly. I'm deducting 1* for bland broth and chewy meats.  

Other than the definitely worth a checking out.  Perhaps we just had a bad night.  May try again in the future.
author: Yves V.

description: This place had by far the worst pho I've ever had the pleasure of eating. I ordered the beef combo pho but instead of getting beef balls, tendon and tripe I straight up got pork. The broth was red and flavorless. The service was subpar but the fact that I got the wrong order and the wrong order tasted bad was enough to encourage me to never ever come back. Don't come here. There's plenty of better places around the corner
author: Helen F.

description:
This is the closest Pho place I have to my area. The decor is definitely nice--much nicer than most Pho places I've been to. The pho itself, though, was ok, but not much better than average. The broth doesn't have much flavor, so it's probably not boiled for any long period of time. Pretty much the kind of Pho quality I would expect if I made Pho at home (but not at a Pho restaurant)

The service was ok. Pho was not-bad. Giving it a not-bad score of 3.
author: Henry L.

description: My go to spot for to-go pho nearby my house. Really like how they package their pho to-go. They also deliver!
author: Lauren B.

description: The food is decent. I'll say that. But we ordered pho and 2 orders of rolls and it was $35. That's bananas, even for San Francisco.
author: Julie S.

description: I can't rate the food because I didn't order anything. I was seated right next to a dirty table, after I asked to not be seated next to a dirty table, and there was one person dining in the entire restaurant. I then sat there while the man disappeared for 5 minutes before I could even order a drink. I got up, and immediately walked to sweet basil across the street where I was greeted immediately, seated in a clean environment, and brought a drink and soup super fast even though my waitress appeared to be very busy.
author: Lauren V.

description: Excellent food!!! We were all craving good Vietnamese food but didn't know where to go. We started looking at menus on line and decided on this one so basically it was a pretty random choice.  When we got there, we were a little nervous because the place was pretty empty. Our party of five was the second one there - yikes! We started with the #2 shrimp and pork spring rolls with a peanut sauce and #50 vegetarian spring rolls with fish sauce.  Both were amazing. For our 5 family style dishes we picked the lemongrass chicken and lemongrass beef.  Both were delicious but unfortunately,  they were both too spicy for me. I would definitely order them again but ask for them without chili. We also had the garlic shrimp noodles which were very light tasting and a top ranking dish.  You could definitely taste the garlic but it did not over power the noodles or the shrimp. Then we had the coconut curry chicken which I think might have been my favorite.  Neither the curry nor the coconut were too strong. It was a nice delicate balance of both.  Finally, we had a vegetable dish but I'm not certain what the name was since it was someone else's choice but it was a great complement to all the other dishes.  FYI, none of the dishes come with rice but three orders were plenty for the five of us.  The service was good. Please don't be discouraged by the empty tables.  Apparently,  the do a lot of take out business as we saw many orders going out the door.  Don't know if we were told ahead of time but the tip was included even though there were only five of us.  This was not a problem for us as much as for them because we might have tipped a little more. We will definitely go back.
author: R M.

description:
Service ehhh so so the lady in the front really rude after asking me if I had a hang over today -_- how unprofessional any ways
I ordered imperial rolls Vietnamese coffee and beef pho came up to 22.00 kind of pricey compared to other places id come back but for sure just for the rolls
author: Chi G.

description:
Almost anything can be made gluten free. They have gluten free fish sauce and oyster sauce. It's the soy sauce that is not gluten free so BBQ items cannot be gluten free. 

I'm taking off a star because a lot of the items we've ordered have not been great. I just stick to the same thing which is the imperial roll and noodle dish. It is amazing!
author: Addie S.

description: Worst place and worst service.  I had the waiter pack our left over and I had ordered an extra rice.  He put the left over food in the extra rice.  When I got home there was hardly a rice in my newly ordered rice because he put them both together and took out the rice so it will fit.  Now I remember why I don't come here for over 5 years.
author: Rico O.

description: This is my go-to pho place. The chicken and beef pho are both excellent. I've tried some other items on the menu and it's all been good, but the pho is what keeps me coming back. The lady who owns the place is nice. There's a new waiter who wasn't so great a few months ago, but has improved a lot since then.
author: Cisco R.

description: I am a regular customer and I got say, this is probably one of the Best Vietnamese food establishments in San Francisco in my opinion! Their menu varies from vegetarian to the juiciest meats you could ever eat from Vietnamese cuisine. If you want something gluten-free, simply ask the waiter and they are able to help you depending on what food you are eating. The owner Kathy is a kind and friendly hard worker. I definitely recommend eating their pho, unlike other places, the broth has minimal amounts of oil in the broth. It is a very healthy and delicious option!
author: Michi W.

description:
This is our go-to spot when we can't kick our pho craving. Can't beat their vegetarian pho with chicken broth if you're leaning away from red meat. The family that owns the place treat us like family and we are always able to get a table or take out in no time. 

Support these neighborhood family places before they're gone! 5 stars all the way!
author: Kamila L.

description: If you're hungry, this is not a place for you. It's pricey and small portion for a Vietnamese Restaurant. I think it's because of the location. It's pretty empty every time I go there and I have to order at least 3  main dishes to fill my self up.  Please make it the American Portion!
author: James L.

description: Great Bun Bo Hue! Perfect spice level, thin noodles, and different sorts of meat. Also great service. Would come back here again Pho sure
author: Payman N.

description:
Saturday lunch - delicious. Got a vermicelli bowl anf lunch special.

The imperial rolls were light and crispy. The starter soup was a nice touch. The five spice chicken was moist and not too spiced. The thai iced tea was smoky and woody.

All in all, a good meal at a decent price. Service was fine as there was only half a dozen in the place.
author: Andy A.

description:
Ordered to go

Garlic Noodles with Chicken : I was looking forward to try this because of the numerous positive reviews. I was disappointed,the noodles were very bland and although the serving size was large, I could count the number of chicken pieces 

Shaken Beef : They were very salty and tasted more like fried tofu balls, lacking any beef flavor 

Beef noodle soup :I liked the broth and it tasted well . I would rate it above average

Over all, disappointing experience . Will not try again
author: Ajay N.

description: I've been eating Vietnamese food in San Francisco my entire 32 years of life. so I kind of have an idea of what im getting and can expect. I've eaten at Golden Lotus because it's the closest and it does the trick. The food tastes really very decent. the wait times are usually a little long and the credit card minimum is $18 which never fails to annoy me. today, I waited 20 minutes for bun, lemon grass beef and fried rice. and for reference- there is a picture of my $10 worth of bun. the quarter is for reference. yes that would be two thin slices of beef about 2-3 inches long. this is before I ate anything but 2 slices of my imperial roll that were each the size of a nickel. no lie, the smallest portions I have ever seen. suuuuuuuper chintzy.
author: Francesca S.

description: I was hungry, so i just walked into this restaurant near by.  I ordered number 16, seafood noodles.  The base of the soup taste much like msg, the portion of the noodle was small.  The only good thing is the customer service.  There is this guy with the glasses was a very professional waiter even though his english is not very good.    The lady boss is very cocky.  Overall, i will not go there again unless i am nearby and wants to eat vietnam noodle.
author: Donna L.

description:
Mediocre pho. It tastes okay but you can certainly find better elsewhere. They're more expensive than most places too, for pho and other dishes like rice plates.

Unfortunately they don't offer nearly as many options for pho as other places do. Lots of pho places will give many options, all with the same price, for different combinations of ingredients. If you want certain things in your bowl, you can ask them to add it in for you, but they'll tack on $4.95 to your order - that brings you up to about $13 for a bowl. You're better off ordering the special bowl ($9.50) that has everything in it and taking out all the stuff you don't want.
author: Allen C.

description: I forgot I had a bad experience until I read my review. Had a better delivery experience yesterday. The chicken veggie soup is bland and has no noodles perfect for a Paelo type fighting a cold. The catfish was good.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Great lunch here yesterday.

This is downtown living, 5 minute walk from sons apartment in the mission district.

I had theSpecial Beef pho and Jen had the Beef Pho and Mags had the curried shrimp in coconut milk.

There were no left overs.

This place is in a dumpy sort of neighborhood but is a really great restaurant. It's one of Jen's favorite places for Pho.

I will be back here again and again.
author: Peter K.

description:
Owner Kathy was manning (or should I say WOmanning?!) the entire lunch crowd on her own, efficiently, smoothly. And the girl got jokes...gotta love her & her winning attitude! 

Wonder Twin had the fabulous, genius idea of photographing the chicken in my Chicken Noodle Soup, as a way to explain what I deem 'acceptable' chicken (because apparently my random, neurotic food rules are difficult to comprehend without visual aids.)  White meat chicken! Boneless! No weird cartilage or fat chunks or veins or discolorations! Broth was flavorful without being loaded w/ MSG (broth in pic is reddish b/c I added siracha.) Generous portion of noodles. Probably one of the only places that serves pho how I like it.

Bill for 2 bowls of pho, imperial rolls (non-bubbly wrapped, but adequately crispy) & 2 teas: $25.99. Very nice!
author: Fancypants X.

description: I have enjoyed pho now for many years and Lotus Garden is some of the best I've had in San Fransico. The restaurant owner is always there, very friendly and makes the restaurant feel welcoming. Delivery service is always fast and very hot.
author: Nick K.

description: Ive had much better Viet food in the past. This was a $38 bill for one beer, Spring rolls, a tasteless fried rice and an OK lemongrass chicken. I've been to many other Viet places where you'd get way better and more food for that price. I was really looking forward to eating here after a long day flying across the country. Flavors were bland, I can surely make better fried rice.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
I have been a big fan of Lotus Garden for many years. It is what I consider to be a very special neighborhood gem, and a place that delivers solid foot at very reasonable prices.  Kathy, the owner, is a really awesome lady who makes me feel at home every time I go there.  My husband and I went for dinner tonight with my son. It had probably been a year since we have all eaten there, and Kathy remembered both my regular order and my husband's regular order!!  Talk about making someone feel welcomed! 

I love the appetizer combo. It is a plate full of dry rice papers (that you soak in water until they soften), mini imperial rolls, meats, noodles, veggies, spices, and sauce that you use to create your own delicious rolls. I think that it's an awesome interactive meal, and I have not seen this on other Vietnamese restaurant menus. It is absolutely delicious and a great sampling of different foods.  My husband had the Pho, and said that it had a nice rich flavor. Our 4.5 year old son had the chicken and veggies, and chowed down.. he even started grabbing broccoli, dipping it in the broth and proclaiming "this is yummy!".  

Is the cuisine authentic? Honestly, I don't know! I have never been to Vietnam.  Is it delicious? Absolutely!!

I love that Lotus Garden is a nice, clean, low-key place to go with my family. It's great to feel welcomed at a restaurant during prime dinner hours with a young boy who often cannot sit still or stay quiet! 

I honestly can't imagine why Yelpers would call Kathy rude. She's a really sweet lady and has always given me and my family amazing customer service. I also do not think itis fair for someone to complain about not being able to order sandwiches in the restaurant. There are no sandwiches on the menu!! There is, however, a huge sign out front that says that people can order sandwiches to go. (I think that this is a separate service for lunch, perhaps?)  In any case,  I hope that you will try it for yourself. It has been a reliable spot for me to eat for around 6 years and I would highly recommend it.
author: Sherri H.

description:
I had bahn mi (sandwich) here, which you order at the counter and then take out. It's quite inexpensive, $4.50 for a tofu sandwich, and pretty standard of the flavor and composition of your average bahn mi (cilantro, pepper, shredded carrot, sauce). The bread was more airy and less crunchy than I prefer my French bread to be, which was sort of meh, but the tofu seemed freshly fried and was quite good.

Overall, I'd go again if I was close by and hungry because it's cheap and pretty good. But it wasn't rockin' my socks off like  Dinosaurs, which I prefer for vegetarian bahn mi. 

I'll definitely come back to try the 
pho, and I saw someone here eating an entire crab, so maybe I'll try some seafood too!
author: Meryl S.

description: Way overpriced! and when they arrived with my delivery they forgot part of my order and said it would be another 30mins!?!? I said forget it take the charge off my card and yet they still expected a tip! The delivery guy even called the boss back to complain about it and they had the nerve to call me and complain about me not giving him a tip?!? Wtf are u serious!! They need to work on getting shit right. FYI the part of my order that did come (the pho) wasn't all that I've had way better and wouldn't eat there again!!
author: Nikki V.

description:
Super love the 5 Spice Roast chicken makes me come back and bring friends here! It's great to dine alone, w/ friends, w/ family. Cathy is always friendly & upbeat.

They have the best Deep Fried Ice cream too! A must-try :)

I am a fan & will continue to recommend this place.
author: Leann S.

description:
The food is mediocre, and the lady at the front counter is consistently rude. My lady and I decided to suck it up and eat here because it's nearby, she would get a sandwich and I'd get some phó. When we were seated, we told the rude lady that my partner would like a sandwich, she informs us that sandwiches cannot be eaten inside the restaurant. This happens to be my second unnerving experience with this lady at this restaurant. I wish I could give this place zero stars for time after time providing a poor experience.

But seriously though, you can buy a sandwich inside the restaurant, but you have to go outside to eat it, even if you're dining with someone eating soup (which is apparently allowed) in an _empty_ restaurant.
author: Michael J.

description:
Came in at 3pm craving pho.  Thought id try something new, which was a mistake. I had the lemongrass fish noodle soup which was bland. The fish was bad and the noodles were low quality. Broth was also flavorless. I left after a few sips, to which the lady at the front asked "you're done already?" 

Mostly, I didn't like the service. The lady was off the bat rude to me. When I walked in, she reminded me despite the numerous signs around that credit card was a $12 min. After getting the bean sprout plate I asked her for some hot sauce and she demanded to know why I couldn't wait til the soup came out. I told her I like to snack on the sprouts (which were still dirty with mud) and she reminded me not to dip directly into the hot sauce bowl. No bottle of sriracha/hoisin, so I used the stale hot sauce she gave me. 

After I called her out on her bullshit she proceeded to tell me I was a very nice person. Wtf?? Didn't even try to address the situation. 

I won't be back.

Also when I walked in, there was a small plate of dumplings on the floor along with a container of toothpicks. Were they feeding a tiny person? A smaller mammal with opposable thumbs? Probably should have been a red flag.
author: Siva M.

description:
My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF, definitely the best south of Market Street!   I work nearby and get lunch here whenever I can.   The combination chicken and vegetable stir-fry rice plate is delicious, with fresh veggies in a super flavorful sauce.   My other go-to dish here is the Chicken salad, which is just the right amount of spicy, with a hint of mint and peanuts.    I've also had the shaken beef, BBQ pork chop, and imperial rolls here.   Great Vietnamese food, as good as I've ever had.

Plus, the prices are very reasonable and the owners are a super nice, sweet little family.
author: Super T.

description: Far too expensive.   Good food,  just not enough.  Small portions for the price.  It's worth going a bit further up Mission Street for better prices (Excelsior has a few Pho places).  Bernal is full of non-natives who are willing to pay too much.  Hipster prices have me going out of my neighborhood for food.
author: Therese R.

description:
The owners and servers are rude and condensing. Which feels a bit like home. Too bad their food is not authentic Vietnamese. 

Come for Vietnamese inspired food with a side of attitude.
author: Jane N.

description:
I write regularly about food, wine, the travel industry and more however rarely do a I post anything on Yelp because I spend so much time creating content on other sites. That said, the service here was SO incredibly god awful -- that I had to take the time to post something.

Never in 30 years have I been treated with that much disrespect and experienced such rudeness. I asked for a receipt and the woman started ranting and raving as if such a request was that out of the ordinary. She was pissed I asked for one and said none of her customers ask for receipts. Then she proceeded to say I'm not going to serve you and cancelled my order.

I stood there dumbfounded and in disbelief -- it was so over the top that it was if someone was playing an April fools joke on me except it was two days late.

I resonate with the review below that said: the customer is not always right,at all, in the establishment!

It's beyond the customer being right - they go out of their way to be cruel, mean spirited, angry and disrespectful to customers.

An hour later I was getting my nails done in that same neighborhood and the woman who owned the place was Vietnamese. I asked her about the place and what she knew about it - she just shook and her head and said NOT GOOD. No Good. She was of course referring to the food so she doesn't go there after a bad experience.

DO NOT support this place - no establishment who treats their customers this badly should be given any love, link love, $$ or otherwise.
author: WeBlogTheWorld B.

description: Great pho! They use the thin ho fun noodles, which I usually come here for if I'm craving a change in my pho. So far I've only tried their pho tai nam which they give a decent amount of meat and it's not too fatty. Their size small is like a medium size bowl. Their broth is spot on, perfectly seasoned. Service is quick too. I've tried their bun thit nuong as well and the grilled pork is very tasty. If you're trying to go to Turtle Tower and don't want to wait, try Lotus Garden, just a few doors down and they serve great Vietnamese food!
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Me and my co worker went today there for lunch, she (my coworker) saw a piece of hair from her food and the server (a guy) were rude. So disappointing because it was close to where we work.. Only 1 server too. Smh
author: Jojo P.

description:
My go to for Pho, Imperial Rolls and Vietnamese Ice Coffee. It's close to my house if I prefer to dine out, but close enough to dine in... 5pm they begin delivery service.

I've been coming to Lotus Garden for a few years now for their cure-all Pho (especially for those heavy hangovers). The ingredients are fresh, the restaurant is clean and the service is immediate. If you're awesome and kind, the owner is fantastic to speak to. Reading these reviews aren't nearly as interesting as hearing her stories about all of you. And although the lady owner seems stand off-ish or "rude" as some of the reviews have expressed, she's actually not...she's a business owner, not your best friend.

Come try the food!

:)
author: Angelique M.

description: As others have said, the pho here is ok. The broth was pretty bland. We came here on a pretty slow night and yet the service still took a while. Granted, there aren't a lot of Pho places near the Bernal Heights area I do hope they stay open.
author: Michelle C.

description: The PHO combo soup is BOMB! Always fresh produce and great service :) Kathy is awesome
author: Sally M.

description:
Few things are more comforting than a tasty bowl of pho.

Few things are as wonderful as a cheap, tasty bowl of pho. For $9 (not including tax/tip), I got a huge bowl of pho tai (thin slices of rare beef with rice noodles) and all the fixings. 

Also tasty: 
+The goi cuon (shrimp and pork rolls wrapped in rice paper; with lettuce, bean sprouts, mint leaves, and rice noodles, served with a tasty peanut sauce.)

Not as tasty:
-The Vietnamese iced coffee. When it was done percolating, I got half a cup's worth of coffee to pour into the huge glass of ice. It could've used loads more of the sweetened condensed milk, too (AKA cream of the heavens... does that sound dirty? That sounds dirty).

TL;DR?
-Decent service.
-Cheap eats.
-Don't bother with the Vietnamese iced coffee.
author: Adena B.

description: After our regular Pho spot closed down about we been on the hunt for a new Pho spot for the past 6 months or so & we just about gave up.. After seeing this place for many years today we decided to give it a try & I'm so glad we did! Food is not greasy the broth is EXCELLENT! And the workers are very friendly which is rare these days! And its super clean inside. I have found our new Pho spot!
author: Natasha M.

description: I love this place. The food is the best Vietnamese I had in the mission especially their special crab recipe. The owner is the friendliest lady I ever met and Her husband makes delicious meals. I always feel I m there for a family treat.
author: Anas H.

description:
The pho is ok but the lady that runs the restaurant makes you want to come back!
Food wise, I'd say 2.5-3 stars...given the neighborhood and its management, it gets 4, especially because they let me sub veggies for noodles in my last pho ga for a mere $1.50!
author: B L.

description: Food is still fine but service was terrible from the new? waitress tonight.  I ordered one dish but when I didn't get what I ordered the waitress insisted I ordered what I got and then charged me extra when I asked that it match the dish I ordered.  My mom ordered an appetizer portion but she gave us the entree size and charged us for that.  The owner is still very sweet but needs to review her staff training.  Not sure we will be back.
author: Ann F.

description: I can't think of a worse dining experience ever. The water came out tasting like soapy bleach after waiting 20 min. Was too afraid to drink it even though I was very thirsty. The "soda lemonade" came and it was a glass FULL of dry powder at the bottom. Tasted like Country Time Lemonade from a decade ago. I mixed it myself and tried to drink it, impossible. I have pretty low standards when it comes to food, but that was just impossible to consume. He actually snapped at us when we asked for hot sauce. 3 of us were dining, and after waiting 20 min after 2 of us got our dish, we asked where the 3rd was and they had never made it. WE WERE THE ONLY ONES THERE. For some reason we left a 10% tip after all that (I've never left anywhere without tipping), and he opened it IN FRONT OF US to see how much we tipped and scoffed about it not being big enough. What?! Also, the food itself was the worst phô I've ever had. I really don't expect much, but for a 70$ tab, I'd rather eat anywhere else.
author: Ursula Y.

description:
...uh, oh...is lotus garden getting crowded?...recently reopened after a fire upstairs...new decor is an upgrade...

...i only have had delicious dishes here...over & over & over again...will always be up for a trip to this place...
author: Bob L.

description: The food here was really good. I really liked the Bun no hue and the imperial rolls. The owner and waitress were really nice to my family. I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Priscilla D.

description: I live in San Francisco for long time and one of my favorite Vietnamese food the city is lotus garden,  kathy is the best she is hostess and owner giving. You the best service and food please check out her restaurant!!
author: Victor R.

description: I've been here several times. An Asian friend introduced me. Very yummy food, clean and quiet. I have never tried their pho, but the food has been consistently good. I rarely give 5 stars, reserving those for the many outstanding restaurants in SF; but if you like Vietnamese food, this is one of the better ones.
author: Albert K.

description:
The waitress (she might also be the owner who knows) was extremely nice. I loved her more than the food. 

I ordered the Shredded Beef Salad. It was good but not top on my list. If it weren't for the Fish Sauce it would be very bland.

My hubby ordered a Chicken veggie dish, can't recall the name, however it was lacking in flavor as well. 

Since we didn't have their Poo, I can't fully say this was a bad place, as I'm sure their Poo is marvelous. I'll have to give another try and update my review then.
author: Lannette G.

description: Got takeout via caviar. The salad rolls tasted like feet and the pho was way below standards. It was the worst $50 I've ever spent.
author: Christina C.

description: 3.5 is way under-rated! It taste so good! I will definitely come back again!
author: Peter H.

description:
I think this is my favorite Vietnamese soup I've found in SF so far (not including South Bay). I got the spicy beef and pork noodle, which was perfect amount of savory and spicy, great noodles and good meat. I had my friend's soup from the regular meat combo noodle, and that was delicious.

I'm not sure they'd stand out as a five-star "wohoo as good as it gets" for a casual dining establishment and I rarely give points for service (I care about food, though definitely a solid 4-star for sure). However, my friends brought their 16 month old and I felt the servers went above and beyond to accommodate - high chair, children's plateware and plastic silverware, and not freaking out when she dumped bowls of food. Thanks :)
author: Aki N.

description:
Imperial rolls-- subpar at best (2 stars)
Pho tai-- nice broth, ridiculously small noodle portion (2 stars)

I honestly don't know what all the 4- and 5-star reviews are about. Those reviews led us to Lotus Garden... and to disappointment.
author: Brett W.

description: Horrible service. Went in for lunch. The entire restaurant was empty with 20-25 tables. I sat down at a table that was for four. The gentleman approached me and asked me to move over to a smaller table. I mentioned that I would rather sit at a bigger table. Gentleman responded that he doesn't want to move the settings and have to clean a bigger table. WTF? I walked out without even saying a word. Probably explains why the entire place was empty during lunch.
author: C B.

description: Sweet, straightforward little joint with decent pho and great apps ... and such a huge menu I'll never be able to try everything. Everything was super fresh, the ambiance plain but warm. It isn't the best deal in town, but its the ONLY Pho anywhere near Bernal. Much less fussy-hipster than the new ramen place.
author: Brooke B.

description:
The pho dishes are alright. They are a little on the bland side and not as flavorful as I had hoped. I also wish they put more noodles in the bowls.

However, I still come here rather often with my co-workers because of its convenient location. Plus, pho soup is perfect on cold, chilly days!

The place is very clean and so are the utensils.
author: Alan L.

description:
My husband and I love this place. We have been regular customers for two years. They have a really good vegetarian pho that we always get when we are craving pho. They have loads other dishes, everything we have had is pretty good. 

Another huge plus is how clean and neat the restaurant always is.
author: Shruti M.

description:
Lady that works here is really nice and friendly :)
Vegetarian pho is absolutely great here
author: pouria m.

description: Deciding if you should come? let me make it easy for you...Difficult parking, big prices with small portions, lumpy noodle, possibly MSG
author: Long C.

description:
We just moved to the neighborhood a few blocks away from Lotus Garden and are so glad that there's a decent place near by whenever a Vietnamese craving kicks in which is pretty darn often.

A staple for me is the thit nuong and they do it right at Lotus Garden. I tend to like my thit nuong a bit stronger on the lemongrass side and they do it right here, but not so much that it's overwhelming. A nice savory vs. sweet balance with their marinade.

The garlic noodles w/ shrimp is a good option albeit as it's a tad on the sweet side it definitely does require some sort of side dish to tame the sweetness otherwise the dish becomes a bit much as a main course.

I really liked the soda lemonade here as it wasn't overly tart and at the same time there wasn't an inch of sugar at the bottom of the drink as with other places.

Definitely my new go-to local spot. Look forward to trying the pho.
author: David H.

description: I love this restaurant. The Pho is really good and I love the shrimp salad appetizer. The staff are really nice and attentive and the restaurant is peaceful. I've eaten here about a dozen times and never been disappointed.
author: Carl W.

description: Nice, clean Vietnamese restaurant located on Mission St. and 29th St. Food is fresh, well prepared and very tasty. Special beef pho and chicken pho were delicious. Service was good, waiter was friendly and welcoming. Prices are average and the portions are more than adequate. We will be back in the near future.
author: Dan S.

description:
We had Chicken Rolls, Chicken Pho and Beef Pho:

The Chicken Rolls were good and the Pho was absolutely delicious.  I wasn't expecting it to be so pricey, but we really enjoyed our meal and the people were very nice.
author: gina e.

description:
Great food and near my house.  My husband says they've totally remodeled the place. It looks like they've also gotten new furniture. 

The pho is big with good, meaty broth. The imperial rolls were good but I thought there could be a few more on the plate.  It did come with lettuce, cucumbers, sauce, mint and Vietnamese mint that the owner grew herself. Very tasty. Probably one of the better imperial rolls. HUbs had the porkchop, rice and veggies. The porkchop was excellent. Grilled perfectly and marinated in a tangy, sweet sauce. I'm not really into sauces or marinades but this one was just right.

As others say, Kathy was very personable.
author: Mona M.

description:
Good, not oily broth. Ingredients were fresh. thinly-sliced beef was delicious

several others in the restaurant ordered chicken pho, which is something I found peculiar, but who knows, maybe it's delicious.

Two bowls of pho tai (which is pho with thinly sliced rare beef) and a vietnamese mooncake or something came to ~$22. Not a bad value at all.

Good, stomach-warming pho on a drizzly day. I approve!

Would have liked some different spicy add-ons. I think they gave siracha as a spicey, which I wasn't too interested in. But the brown sauce was very good
author: Shawn S.

description: Only gave it 2 stars because the food isn't bad but the service kinda sucked. I had hair in my food and brought it to the waiter's attention and he told me it wasn't hair -__- like really? Sounded like he didn't want me to take my money back smh  Anyways NEVER going back here.
author: Vi P.

description: This place does bizarrely fast delivery, like 10 minutes after I order there is delicious vietnamese food at my door. Their  stir-fying is especially good. And the Thai Iced Tea! The imperial rolls are delicious but comically small- and if you think they're small at lunch, thinking you're being clever and getting the imperial rolls combined with something else at dinner for more money will only get you improbably smaller slivers on a bed of noodles next time around. You'd have to order probably six things of imperial rolls to get something equal to the size of one egg roll. Normally, this would leave me enraged, but they're so good, and so fast, and the lady who takes orders didn't judge me (audibly, at least) when I ordered from them 3 times in 2 days, so I'd definitely still recommend them: just know what you're getting into.
author: Maria G.

description:
Went in on a Sunday and the place was empty.  First thought? *oh crap this is going to suck.  I just hope I don't get food poisoned*  Keep in mind we never been here and didn't read any of the previous Yelp reviews.  So we continued the adventure and sat and ordered pho.  I had the beef pho.  Delicious.  Clean.  And with a touch of black pepper in the broth (which I've never had in pho before), made the bowl of pho brilliant.  

Now that I have read other reviews, I learned this place was closed some time due to the fire that occurred next door.  Maybe people don't know it's open again so that could explain the lack of crowd.  Nonetheless, crowd or no crowd, they got a big fan in me.  Can't wait to try other dishes.
author: Steve O.

description:
WARNING - BE CAREFUL ABOUT THE FOOD CLEANLINESS - I GOT FOOD POISONING OR THE STOMACH FLU EATING HERE

I got chicken pho to go on Friday night (2/10).  The pho was good, but I got a horrible stomach bug the next day.  It was either food poisoning, or a stomach flu.  I couldn't eat anything, and alternated between diarrhea and vomiting.  Had painful stomach cramps, and a fever, which prevented me from getting any sleep at all.

WARNING - EAT AT LOTUS GARDEN AT YOUR OWN RISK.  THE FOOD CLEANLINESS AND HYGIENE IS EXTREMELY POOR.  YOU DON'T WANT TO GET FOOD POISONING OR THE STOMACH FLU!

I will never ever eat at this restaurant again!
author: Ramon C.

description:
Food? Decent Vietnamese--I've only come here for the pho tai take out, and it's not bad. 

Service? Atrocious. Apparently I have an "I love to argue" sign hanging around my neck every time I come to this restaurant, because every time the owner is there she is confrontational with me. I never knew there was so many ways one can f*ck up a pho(ne) order, but apparently I've done them all! Perhaps something is getting lost in translation, but I won't be returning here.
author: Gabe P.

description: If I could give a half star I would, and it would simply be for the cleanliness of the restraint because that was the only decent thing! I have been to many pho places in many cities and this was one of the worst experiences I have had! First they don't have a size option for their pho! The bowls are tiny, and I like my pho! Second, I like a little extra onion and when I asked for a side of onion to add to my pho he said he would have to charge me 1.50! For extra onion? Yeah right! On top of it all they don't offer chili oil! And the owner tried to tell me that authentic pho doesn't require chili oil, then why does every other "authentic" pho place offer it? The customer is not always right,at all, in the establishment! The pho it self lacked flavor and was not " authentic" with the strong spices and rich flavors! If you want good pho this is not your go to spot!
author: Maggie S.

description:
Service is TERRIBLE.  The woman who took our order was so incredibly rude - cutting me off when I answered her questions.  And the delivery took almost an hour and a half. 0 Stars for that.

The food, though, was amazing.  We had all vegetarian stuff - coconut curry with eggplant was fantastic. And the lemongrass tofu was great, too. 

Probably only eat in for the future... maybe not.
author: Briana M.

description: Lotus Garden is a terrific little Vietnamese Diner, that my partner Victor introduced me to recently.  Great food, convenient location on Mission Street and the owner Kathy is sooo sweet..
author: Kent W.

description: Maybe we were there on an off night, but my chicken pho broth was so bland it was more like hot water. Also disappointing was my boyfriend's spicy beef pho which was greasy with tough slices of meat slicked with iridescent oil. The imperial roll was underdone and unimpressive. That said, the restaurant was very clean and the service was very nice and it is definitely reasonably priced, just completely disappointing. I don't get why the ratings are so high.
author: Paisley S.

description:
Cold January day and I felt a cold coming on. Usually I will eat homemade chicken vegetable soup or a big bowl of pho to counter attack the affects of an oncoming cold. I thought about going to my usual spot for pho, but I didn't want to trek out in the cold that far. Thought about going to get some won ton soup up the street, but wasn't really up to won ton soup. I thought about making my homemade chicken veggie soup, but I would have to go out and buy the chicken since I didn't have any in the freezer, so I settled on pho from Lotus Garden. Never tried food from here even though it's only 1/2 a block from where I live. I always felt it was a little (just a little) pricey for Vietnamese food, but I figured, what the hell. I was craving pho.

Instead of dining-in for lunch, I decided to eat my pho at home, so I ordered takeout. Not much of a selection with their pho. I noticed no tripe, flank steak, etc. I settled on their Pho Tai (beef) and I was also craving something crunchy, so ordered their Chagio (imperial rolls). My order was going to take about 10-15 min. and sure enough it did (about 10 or so). When I went to go pick up my order, the place wasn't packed, but it was the start of lunch and they opened at 11 a.m. Nice restaurant. I've been in here only once before when it was  Japanese restaurant. I like that there's been a variety of Asian restaurants/cafes opening-up in Bernal Heights, although I can do without the yuppie/hipster bars.

The food: I read one person's review on here that the broth of the pho was "overrated." Well, I beg to differ. I'm not a connoisseur of Pho, but I've had pho at many different places. The first time I had it was...let's see...29? 30? years ago in the Tenderloin. When my sisters and I took our first sip of the broth back then, we were hooked. Lotus Garden's broth reminded me of that day. Clear, rich, and oh so good. I did taste a slight sweetness to it though, but I've read that different regions in Vietnam make their pho differently...at least the broth is. I'd have to say Lotus' broth is up there with my usual spot for pho, but not as good as Pho Tan Hoa's. If anything, I could've just slurped the broth itself and forget the beef, noodles, etc., but wanted the whole shebang!! The broth was separate from the beef and noodles and came in a container, while the beef (raw), noodles, bean sprouts, and other condiments came in a plastic container, so you can add them together when you get home. Oh, and if you do order the pho for takeout and eat it at home, make sure you use a large (I mean big) bowl. I kinda miscalculated my bowl and forget that after adding the noodles and beef, etc. would make the broth spill over the sides of my bowl. Luckily I slurped some of the broth and was able to transfer it to a larger bowl and not lose any broth. 

The Chagio, was crunchy and delish! This was an appetizer, but it was a meal in itself. It came with a small mound of vermicelli rice nooldes, shredded carrots and daikon radish, cucumber slices, three huge lettuce leaves, mint, cilantro, bean sprouts, and fish sauce. You get three imperial rolls that are cut in half. I would definitely order this appetizer again just for a small meal. 

Right now, I wish I had another bowl of pho because it's another cold day in January. I would definitely order takeout here or have lunch/dinner here again. For a neighborhood Vietnamese restaurant, this is a  reasonably-priced place to eat. I think they just need to add a variety of beef pho to their menu. Other than that, definitely good eats!! =)
author: Neni E.

description: Ok place if you live in the neighborhood... I definitely wouldn't go out of my way to eat here if there was another Vietnamese option closer. Food is decent, but if you're ordering for delivery or take out, just make sure the order is correct once before you hang up, and again when in hand. Depending on who answers the phone, you're order might be exactly as you ordered it, or every single thing might be wrong. Their spicy pho is great.
author: Laura S.

description:
It's Friday night, and it's raining... I was going to go to the market and make some soup tonight... but I can't motivate myself out of the house.  Anyhow, what I really want is some Pho...

Enter Lotus Garden Vietnamese Cuisine.  Woo-hoo!!!  A local Bernal Heights restaurant.  Woo-hoo 2!!!!!

A very nice woman answered the phone and took my order.  She informed me that they had A LOT of take out orders tonight and that it would take a little longer than normal.  No probs here :) an informed customer is a happy customer.  We only had a hundred dollar bill, she said she'd let the driver know to bring lots of change.  

We ordered and would order again:

Pho Ga
Pho Tai
Imperial rolls

Everything was divine, warm delicious soup with lots of fresh fixings. So happy to have a great Vietnamese restaurant that delivers!!!!
author: Lani N.

description:
This place has one of the best bowls of vegetarian pho I've ever had.  Usually don't order veggie pho (I mean c'mon, "veggie pho"?  Isn't that an oxymoron, or somewhat blasphemous?) but I was recovering from the flu and couldn't tolerate meat or seafood for a while.  The few times I have ordered veggie pho in the past at other places, I was rewarded with yucky blandness.

It's not easy to make vegan pho flavorful, but I was surprised at how good it was!  Hints of lemongrass, rich and full-flavored, slightly peppery, not greasy.  Even the noodles and veggies themselves were infused with flavor.  I'm sold.  The only quibble (minus one star):  I would like to see more Eastern veggies (bok choy, sprouts) and fewer Western veggies (broccoli, carrots).

My dining partner had vegetarian spring rolls and stir-fried rice noodles, which he said were also delicious.

Owner and staff are very friendly and helpful.  Minus one starfor a rather chilly dining room (temperature wise), but plus one star for sparkling-cleanliness.

The dining room was pretty empty at 8PM - we almost didn't go in.  Glad we did, and we will be back for sure.  I hope they get more customers and stick around!
author: Esther K.

description:
I'm part Viet and the beef broth is...over rated. I was expecting a heavier broth as this was a super light citrus-y one that tasted underbrewed. The beef didn't sink it's flavors into the soup as it should've and I was disappointed there weren't more beef options for the pho such as tripe, tendon, brisket, beef combos like at other Viet restaurants. 

The noodles were fine though. No other complaints either. I did enjoy the calm atmosphere and the waitress was so nice. 

I noticed vegans come here, I overheard two loud old men drill the waitress about the dish contents and how it's prepared. They were happy to hear the detailed description and stayed for lunch.

Sorry, I'm no vegetarian, pescatarian, nor of course vegan, so I'm searching for another pho spot around my neighborhood.
author: Jayme N.

description: The food wasn't authentic which was disappointing. It was also overpriced. I wouldn't go back or recommend it, which is why I am giving two stars :-/ .
author: Claudia L.

description:
This is a really solid neighborhood Vietnamese place that doesn't seem to be getting the customer love they deserve now that they've reopened after a fire.

My pork, imperial rolls, and crab and corn soup were all straighforward, tasty and satisfying. They're certainly going to become a staple in our takeout rotation. 

Better across every possible dimension than Siam Saigon across the street.
author: Amy L.

description: Though oddly quite, Lotus Garden is clean, quick, and yummy no nonsense Vietnamese food. Pho Ga and Pho Tai were fresh and perfect for a foggy night, the imperial rolls were the best we've had in the neighborhood ( and thanks for the tip on wrapping the roles!). Going to try takeout next.
author: David M.

description: Pretty good for a late night snack.  The owner of the place is nice and the food is decent.  I didn't like the price and how much of food you get.  I paid almost 10 bucks and felt like I had a medium sized bowl portions.  At that price I would get a big bowl of Pho!  Parking is a little tough, but if you are willing to pay for parking, that is available everywhere.
author: Daniel Z.

description: Neighborhood restaurant. Not the greatest but there are no other vietnamese places around Noe Valley so i'll take it. Friendly staff! Nice and quiet place to have dinner. But i think i'll onlydo take out thou...
author: Kevin W.

description:
My husband and I thought we would try this place since it was close to our house and we both love Vietnamese food. We walked in and the atmosphere was nice but after that it was all down hill.

The server that we did get was extremely rude. They actually yelled at customers at other tables from our table. The food was cold and we paid way to much for what we got. Our bill was over $50.00 and we split a main coarse and got 2 appetizers with no drinks.

Never again. I don't need to be yelled at when paying for a service.
author: michelle b.

description: Great Pho with a comsumme quality delicious clear broth. Possibly the Best I've in SF
author: Kevin W.

description:
My girlfriend and I ordered Lotus Garden's delivery a few weeks back.  I really, really wanted to like it.  Vietnamese is one of my favorites, and this place was nearby and happened to deliver.  All it would've taken to earn my regular business was basic, competently executed food.  It didn't happen.

BBQ pork rolls - these were big, but that was their only virtue.  Not very flavorful.

Sauteed prawns with coconut and curry sauce - worst of the dishes we tried.  I'm trying to think of a good way to describe the sauce, but weird is the only word that comes to mind.  Worse still were the "prawns" themselves - measly, limp shadows of what they should've been.  Picture a 6 month-old bag of small, frozen shrimp.  That's what we're talking about here.

Clay Pot Special - I guess you could call this the winner.  Pretty tasty dish, with the chinese sausage adding a lot of flavor.  Fairly small portion, though.

All restaurant owners have to think about food costs.  Lotus Garden is thinking too much about it (or not enough?), and their dishes show it.
author: Craig M.

description: Gotta love the charming attitude of the owner.  Fried rolls are like crack. And chicken soup like your Vietnamese mamma used to make!
author: Adam G.

description:
SO GROSS! And abusive, too!

Pho soup came with, I believe, sliced leather shoe-tongues that had been dried in a low oven. This was actually the dried-out rind and sheer fat/gristle, not even edible meat.

I called to complain (this was a delivery order) and the lady screamed at me that "her soup has no complaints for 13 years."  Then she SENT THE DELIVERY GUY BACK TO PICK UP THE FOOD so she could inspect it and "decide for herself".

Even better, I've now got *4* messages on my vm berating me for sending the food back "eaten." I guess she also wanted us to return the pieces we tried to chew and had to spit out.

"Vegetarian" beans came with (I think it was) pork.  Crazy lady shrieked that it's not meat but "radishes." I know radishes, madam, and that was no radish.

Delivery guy did in fact come back for the food, and what a Satan-look he gave me.

Weird. Bad. Stay away.
author: Marie D.

description:
Kathy had to temporarily close, due to a fire next door, the water damage caused flooding in their place and now has to be completely remodeled.
Look for them to Open soon, hoping by December, miss them and their great food and service.
author: Darrell L.

description: Just perfect.  Fresh beautiful food and lovely, charming service.  The atmosphere was very clean, simple and elegant.
author: Karyn S.

description:
My friends and I stopped here for a late lunch, and when we walked inside, there were only 2 people eating in the restaurant. No one greeted us, but we went ahead and sat down at a table. After a few minutes, a woman came out from the kitchen and took our order. My order (pan fried noodles with chicken) came out quickly before the other two (even though one order was the same thing I ordered), which was odd.  

The food itself is nothing to laud about. The noodles were really soggy with fish oil, the chicken had very little flavor (even though it was dusted with a little ground black pepper), and the vegetables were nothing special. The server didn't provide us with any sauces or soy sauce. Instead, I had to grab it from the table where the two people sat (after they left). Overall, I was fairly disappointed. I do not think I'd go back.
author: J.D. Q.

description:
I almost never write reviews, and wasn't going to because I didn't want others to find out about this local gem, but the number of stars just seemed way too low.

I go to Lotus Garden every time I am coming down with a cold. The Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup) is the one thing I find I still have an appetite for, even when I'm feeling bad. I get it to go, and it comes with a heaping pile of noodles, perfectly cooked chicken slices, all the toppings you would want. The broth is heavenly: lightly fragrant but still satisfying. 

I'd also recommend the Combo appetizer. I often order it as an entree, because it comes with everything I'd want: Imperial rolls, lemongrass pork, sauteed shrimp, rice paper and everything you need to make your own spring rolls. So good. It goes down well with a bottle of Hue beer.

The price is right, and the family that owns this place is super sweet. I've never gotten bad service or bad food here. It's never too crowded...although if more people taste their pho broth, that might change quickly.
author: CJ L.

description: Sucks -  There was maybe 30 strands of noodles in my entire bowl of pho.  Imperial rolls sucked too.   It tasted atleast meh to me because I had just returned from Florida and had not eaten Asian food in several days.
author: Wakako U.

description: Me and my boyfriend went to here for pho. Since he's not hungry, he decided not to order food. And when we made the order I can hear the waitress and the owner is talking us in their language in a bad way. And the resturant owner-- the mean lady said they have minimum order per person for $8. I been eating pho everywhere in SF. NEVER heard of minimum order such thing for PHO!!!!! Are you for real? So we left! Thank you mean lady. You can save up all the pho you want and eat it yourself.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Hadn't been here since it reopened after the fire. We ordered an all vegetarian meal to go: Deep Fried Vegetarian Rolls, Sautéed Mixed Vegetables w/ Coconut & Curry Sauce, Lemon Grass Tofu w/ Chilies, and Garlic Noodles.

The veggie dishes were among the better we've had in San Francisco, even close to Suriya Thai in excellence. The garlic noodles were tasty, but somewhat generic. (The first thing I told my wife was "I bet we could make these": they seemed like spaghetti with garlic and parsley. Tasty, though!)

Even for take-out, the staff was very friendly. It will definitely go on our shortlist for weekly takeout.
author: Louis B.

description:
In a sea of burritos and pad thai, I finally stopped by here the other day for some to-go.  Here is a small place that seems to try very hard to succeed, and it shows.  The guy there sort of reminded me of Jet Li ... very quiet, polite and soft spoken.

I ordered the Imperial Rolls, which came with lettuce, mint, carrots, daikon and fish sauce dip.  They could have had more filling, but still good.

Shaking Beef .... very good, but the lettuce was completely cooked by the time I got it home.  I think it would have been nicer to have the lettuce on the side, so it stays cold and crisp.

Beef in Lot Leaf ... another very good dish.  The "lot" leaf was very pronounced, and large, not like a few other places.  Served with the same fish sauce.  I will get this again!

Garlic Butter Noodles .... lots of garlic flavor and butter.  Thinner noodles than other places.  I have some leftover for lunch today!

Pan Fried Noodles with Beef ... this one is good too, with lots of veggies and beef.  You can also order this with Shrimp, Pork, or Chicken.

A great place for vegetarians and meatatarians (more royalties to Marsha Z)  Not too cheap, but still worth a look.
author: Michael M.

description:
I only got to try a couple things here, and they were both great! I didn't see a point of them grilling the chicken at the table - it would have been the same to me if they grilled it in the kitchen, but I guess it makes for a nice show. It's hard to find Vietnamese food in the city that's menu doesn't consist solely of twenty types of pho and bun. That's right folks - Pho Dac Biet was NOT #1 on the menu.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
We had just discovered Lotus Garden and had vowed to return when the fire next door forced them to close! I wasn't sure they were going to make it but we were so ecstatic when we found out they were re-opening on October 18th.

I looooove their shaking beef. I've had shaking beef at a few different places, and although it's not quite as good as Slanted Door's $40 filet mignon version, you can't beat what Lotus Garden serves for less than $10.

They're back in business so go check them out!
author: J W.

description:
Omg I'm so disappointed with this place! The food was so freakin awesome but the service was horrible. I wanted to walk out the minute I sat down but the only thing that stopped me was the $7 parking fee.  

I got a table for 2 (just my 6 year old and I)  We ordered a bowl of pho with just beef balls and a plate of garlic noodles with prawns. I really came here for crabs but the lady told me I had to order in advance before I came in....hmmm ok. But whatever.

So the whole time there, they didn't even acknowledge us. There was this white couple there...that was getting all the service in the world. The lady stood there next to the couple talking to them even after the food has arrived. You could tell they were feeling a little awkward like hmmmm...."okkkkk can we eat in peace now?"

It's so sad that the service freakin sucks here cause the food is so good :(
author: Melanie S.

description: It is unfortunate that this has to be my first yelp review.  Lotus Garden is right in our neighborhood and a short walk so my wife and I were excited to grab some take out after a long day.  It was about 8:30 on a Friday night and the restaurant was completely empty.  They seemed to be wanting to close up early and were not very receptive to our small takeout order.  My wife ordered the Vietnamese spring rolls.  It took about 10 minutes to get them and we walked home to enjoy our food.  Her first bite into the roll and there was a BIG LONG HAIR intertwined into the vermicelli.  That was it for us and the food went into the trash.  Very disappointing that we came home without anything to eat.  I would not recommend dining here based on this experience.
author: Brian W.

description: DO NOT GO HERE!!!!! the guy in the front was first super mad that i asked for a water when i already ordered a soda then i think he thought that we were three dumb teenagers and literally stole our money. when I asked for the receipt back because the math was not adding up I saw him go to the back with a pen and scribble down a bunch of numbers and did not even give me my original receipt back. my original receipt said 32.75 but the one he gave me said 36.95 DO NOT GO HERE THEY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY
author: Gabby R.

description: Lotus Garden is officially my go-to place for anything Vietnamese. The staff is friendly and patient--even when I showed up on my birthday with 20+ people dressed like pirates, they gave excellent service. When I returned to apologize for the craziness that was the pirate party, the owner just laughed and said it was fine. She is a super nice lady and deserves your business! I recommend the Pan Fried Soft Noodles w/ Prawns--DELICIOUS.
author: Risa P.

description:
$20 got me:

1 order of bland imperial rolls.
1 chicken noodle soup (chicken pho).  

The pho was less than ideal-  3 measly thin slices of chicken (each slice being the size and width of a green bean, a few bean sprouts, and noodles.  It was the saddest bowl of soup I have ever seen.  

I felt conned.  


(two pros:  broth was good.  and they deliver in the mission.)
author: Connor S.

description:
Keep the line moving folks, Nothing to see here.

We got delivery from them;

chickne pho -ok
beef pho - good
rice plate- (I don't remember which one exactly)  ok

The menu wasn't accurate in reflecting the prices.
I could have sowrn the total was about 22$ on the phone but when the delivery boy got here, it was 32$ not including tip. Oww!

The portions stunk for the price.


Hope you have better luck where ever you go.
Good Luck My Fellow Yelpers
author: vin t.

description:
I had pho gà (chicken noodle soup) here yesterday. It's just mediocre. Whoever said pho gà here compares to Thap Rua doesn't seem to know what he's talking about. I'm from Hanoi where pho gà is from. And this is nothing like that. The broth is too sweet, def not cooked by somebody from Hanoi. Thap Rua is much closer to the real Hanoi food. 

The service is good though. And the place is nicely decorated and clean. I won't come back for pho gà though.
author: Thuan L.

description: Great Pho here. The spicy seafood soup is one of their specialties. I usually get the Chicken (Pho Ga) soup here. Fresh garnish veggies (basil, sprouts, peppers, ect.). The fresh rolls are also awesome tasty peanut sauce. Clean restrooms, with soap and paper towels.
author: Silicon W.

description: We tried pho -- it's decent. I think their soup is less flavorful but this is the only one where serves Vietnamese food around this area. It's also priced decent or slightly expensive.
author: Naho I.

description: I'm surprised at the bad reviews here. I've been here many times. The pho is tasty and the other dishes on the menu are also really yummy. The lady who owns the place is a sweetheart and nice to talk to. My favorite pho place!
author: Laura R.

description:
I ate here only about a few times since its relatively close by my house.

I had done takeout pho from here before for dinner. Basically they charge an extra dollar because its dinner time, and the portion is about the same as the lunch portion. Felt kind of ripped off. I paid around $9 for the pho, which is pretty overpriced.

Another time I ate here and ordered a rice plate. The lunch special came with a soup as well. The soup was alright, just seemed like bland soup with vegetables. My rice plate was decent, the portion seemed kind of small for a lunch, lets just say I could have still eaten after the meal. Overall the food is okay, nothing special. I've had about the same or better at other locations that are slightly further. This place does charge you more than your average Vietnamese restaurant, but it is cleaner than your average Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Johnson S.

description: This is my neighborhood place, and I love them. The owners are friendly and funny,  the Bun and Pho are very good, and it's cheap. If you want high-end, keep looking, but if you want delicious food in a humble atmosphere, this is your place.
author: Patrick B.

description: Love this place. They taught me how to properly eat imperial rolls. The best house fried rice and garlic shrimp.
author: trineice d.

description: Giving them five stars just for their Pho it really is excellent and I've tried many of the other spots in the city.
author: Shane O.

description: I thoroughly devoured my flavorful spicey beef pho & perfectly crunchy imperial rolls, and enjoyed sipping my hot tea as if it was giving me the perfect amount of herbal goodness my body needed. Ummmm, yes, I'm jocking this place. Go there & you'll find out why! Also, the owner was very sweet & funny :)
author: Amethyst Popkiss A.

description:
One of my most favorite restaurants while visiting San Francisco. The owner always takes care of us. You can tell her heart and soul are in this business. I keep ordering the same thing, dammit. Always request the drunken crab which isn't on the menu, but it is absolutely delicious! Tiny bits of ginger, garlic, basil and sweet wine all wok seared into the tasty  Dungeness crustacean. Get it with a side of buttery garlic noodles and a crepe for an appetizer and you will leave with a full belly and greasy fingers.
This time I ordered shaking beef as well. It was good, but a few too many onions and a little more beef would have been perfect.
I love this little place, often going way out of the way to eat there. Highly recommended.
author: R Y.

description: So I love Vietnamese food, and because my all time favorite Tu Lan closed downtown, I had to search for other funky places to try. While the place was recently renovated and is clean and nice, the food was a bit over-priced and not very tasty. I'm no expert, but when I pay 8 dollars for an appetizer of Imperial Rolls, I expect at least 2 decently sized rolls, but we only got two super tiny, thin rolls about the size of our fingers (literally) and a whole plate of lettuce that we were supposed to wrap them in. Strange. And the Pho was really bland compared to the other Vietnamese places I've been to. However, despite this, the service was great, and the owner ( I think) was very friendly and obviously cared about her business.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Warm welcome back!  This casual place is great and definitely a neighborhood favorite.  They have excellent customer service, especially the owner; she really makes you feel like you're at home.  The food is fresh, light, and tasty.  I can't get enough of the pho -The broth is crystal clear, piping hot, packs a ton of flavor, and comes with all the right fixings.  You can't lose with this place.

Oh yeah!  FYI -One thing I always phoget is that they are closed on Mondays.
author: Sony R.

description:
After a couple visits, I was only mildly impressed with the dishes at Lotus Garden.  From the the lemon grass soups to the cold chicken salad, I figured this establishment was adequate.  But our recent order (delivered to my door on a cold, rainy evening) was really good .  

We started with the vegetarian crepe that heated up nicely in the microwave and dressed it with Asian basil, mint, carrots, cucumber and a sauce.  The cold chicken salad with crispy fish chips and fish sauce is always a winner at our table.  The main course was garlic noodles and chicken sauted with vegetables over steam rice.  The garlic noodles were stupendous and the chicken breast tasted like it was grilled on charcoal...perfectly moist.

We needed to heat up the crepe, noodles and sauted chicken, but, hey, what can you expect with a delivery right to your doorstep?  And yes, it all warmed up nicely.  Next time, the garlic noodles are a must order.  By the way, all four items totalled $42 including the delivery guy tip.  And the next-day leftovers were scrump-dittily-ump-tious.
author: K P.

description:
Just had the chicken pho and imperial rolls here because we didn't want to drive 5 miles to the sunset, downtown or clement. 

The food was pretty good - the rolls came with all the expected trimmings which were fresh and the pho was tasty and large. 

One star off for the excellent, polite service and for being exceptionally clean. Someone needs to tell the owners that's not the right way for a Vietnamese place in the city. Well, ok, one star off for not being earth shatteringly phenomenal, but I will definitely be back.
author: Robert D.

description: Can't ever say no to pho. Love the owner and her family. And yes, I WILL pay the extra 2 dollars to have the meatball added to the number to Pho.
author: Niki M.

description:
This place is in my neighborhood and I am very happy that I can get Vietnamese Food so close to my house in the Mission/Bernal Area.

I wandered in here with my sister and my friend, Bill because we had a hankering for Vietnamese and we were not disappointed!
