It's a pretty solid little restaurant that has all of the basics and is a small step above your typical hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese Joints.
We had their Crab Garlic Noodles which we all thought were really good.  So good that we ordered another...  
To quote my friend, BIll, 'The Garlic Noodles kicked ass!'
Their Imperial Rolls were the real deal and were made with Rice Paper and not the Chinese Egg Roll Wrapper.
We also had the the BBQ Beef Spring Rolls where you were given Rice Paper Wrappers to prepare your own Spring Rolls.
The only thing we couldn't get was Pho, because they only serve it for Lunch.  Will hafta go back to give it the ol' 'Pho Test' some time... 

Oh yeah, they also have their own Dungeness Crab tanks, so that's another thing to go back for and try with their kick-ass Garlic Noodles.  Apparently they are known for their Crab and their Raw Beef Carpaccio, which are also now on my list.  Will report back...

We thought that the folks who worked there were incredibly nice people, it is family-owned by Kathy & her husband who is the Chef, and the Food was very good.  So if you live in the 'Hood and don't feeling like haulin' your ass to Little Vietnam in the 'Loin, then Lotus Garden is a great alternative.
author: Rose C R.

description: Great pho is all about the broth. And Lotus Garden spends time on their broth and in my humble opinion obliterates Sunflower and outranks Golden Star. I introduced my extended family from Germany to Lotus Garden and in the few days they were here, they wanted to go back twice, and now because of their experience they're going to Vietnam next month! We've gone here for birthdays, Mother's Day, and celebrations. Kathy, the owner, is wonderful and has such a welcoming personality. I agree with another tipper though, pass on the garlic noodles.
author: Jean M.

description:
Had a very weird lunch here today. I was the only customer. Ordered Imperial rolls and bbq'd pork on rice noodles. 

I got my bun, mixed up the ingredients, dressed with fish sauce, and ate a few pieces of Imperial roll before I realized I hadn't gotten the bbq pork with it. Asked the server for the bbq pork and was told if I wanted the error corrected, she'd have to take my bowl back to the kitchen and remove some of the Imperial roll to replace it with the bbq pork.

The Imperial roll was bland and mushy inside so I sent it back to be replaced with bbq pork, which wasn't so great either. I'm sure they threw out the pieces of Imperial roll.

This kind of stinginess bespeaks a restaurant that's on the bubble, or at least does not have its priorities straight. I won't be going back.
author: Crabcakes C.

description:
I can't say enough good things about this place.  Not only is the food really good (and they deliver!), but the owners are the nicest people.  I left my wallet here once after dinner, and the owner DROVE to my house to try to return it!*

Now THAT'S customer service, and a way to make anyone a repeat customer.

The food is good, and I enjoyed everything we ate.  All and all, a great spot for a bite to eat.

* I of course was already in SoCal, with no wallet, and had only an inkling of where I left it.  Nothing like a weekend away with no ID, money, or a clue.
author: Erika C.

description: I have eaten here many times, both delivery and eat-in. Always liked it. Today I tried to order delivery (as I have many times), called, gave my address and cross street, as per normal. But then, the person who answered the phone started quizzing me about my location, asking if I was "at the top of the hill" (I am on Cortland Ave, almost exactly one mile from the restaurant, aka walking distance). Apparently she didn't like the answer I gave her; truthfully, I don't think she understood what I was telling her about my location (not that it was complicated...) I explained my relative location several times (this, of course, after giving exact address and cross-street) and in several ways and she finally said "thirty-five to forty dollar minimum." Since I was ordering for only two people (probably in the 25 to 30 dollar range) I said thank you and hung up. If there is now a $40 minimum for a 1.1 mile delivery . .  thanks but no thanks. Will never eat here again.
author: Christy B.

description:
This is my 1st review, though I've been on Yelp for years and am a major foodie. Why, you ask? Because this place is awesome, and it'd be a shame if they went out of business. After seeing Heart go out of business, I don't want to see another gem go down. Normally I don't review restaurants I like, b/c I don't want them to get crowded, and I don't give bad reviews b/c I don't mind if people crowd out bad restaurants instead of the ones I like. I'm a bad person, I guess. 

But this place is always empty, so, I'm worried, and the food is amazing. Plus, it's surrounded by lots of Asian competition, but it beats them all: Jasmine Teahouse, Pad Thai, the new Siam Saigon right across the street (!), Wild Pepper, etc. I've tried them all, and they're all good. 

Aside from being the only all-Vietnamese of the bunch, Lotus Garden does something different. The sauce is always light so you can really taste the ingredients, which are fresh and prepared to perfection (especially the veggies and noodles). It's a more minimalistic approach instead of getting hit over the head with a thick sauce: i.e. sweet and sour sauce on thickly breaded protein that leaves you feeling heavy. So not only is it tasty, but it's more healthful, and you don't leave tired and bloated. 

Everything I've had on the menu is great, but somethings that come to mind are the Chicken Pho (best I've had), and the Crispy Noodle dish (a bunch of veggies and protein on top of crispy noodles). 

Plus, there's never a wait. So get over there and support these guys. Family owned. Mother's recipes. They're sweet. It would be a shame to lose them!
author: Ben M.

description: Very good Vietnamese food, clean and not super oily. Definitely will be back soon!!!
author: Paul R.

description:
My noodles were okay, but not great.

The service was strange.  They brought out some people's food 10 minutes before other people's food.
author: Niniane W.

description:
3.5 stars.  Not your typical we-only-serve-pho vietnamese restaurant.  Try something with rice for a change!

Pros:
+  The catfish fillet was AWESOME!  So steamy, flavorful, with a nice texture.  Didn't disintegrate on my fork like some fish can.  Garnished with green onions and cilantro which might seem insignificant to some, but makes a huge difference in taste!
+  Shrimp and Pork Rolls rocked too!  Had mint leaves, which many Vietnamese places forget about.  The peanut sauce was delish and didn't have sesame seeds, which I'm allergic to.
+  Never busy (lots of people get take out) so service is fast, yet friendly.
+  Served the coffee some neat Vietnamese contraption which makes the experience cooler!

Cons:
-  Some items are overpriced.  Shrimp and pork rolls $6.95 for 2 and a really small, about 8oz. of Vietnamese coffee for $3.50.
-  Total for one order of rolls, catfish fillets ($9.95), 2 orders of rice, and 2 coffees came out to be $30.  I thought that by splitting an appe and a main dish would save me money...but here, not so much.
-  Portions are smaller than other sit-down Asian restaurants.  I guess they are just giving real serving sizes, but my belly says, "this sucks!"
-  The Vietnamese coffee gave me a tummy ache!  I think there was too much condensed milk.
-  Credit card minimun $10 for lunch, and $15 for dinner.

Bottom Line:  I will be back.  That's all that matters right?  Tasty food, but next time I'll be more choosy about what I get so my bill isn't as high.
author: Liezl C.

description: This is one of my go to delivery spots!  Never actually ate there but their delivery food and service kicks ass!!  I've been ordering from here for 5+ years and they're always good...very consistent.  Shaking beef, imperial rolls, lemon grass beef, clay pot rice, pork chops...it's all good!!! Delivery service to Potrero Hill is quick too!
author: Ramon L.

description:
So glad this place is around. They've been my go-to place for Vietnamese for years.
Their food is consistently good. They have a nice, clean dining room and they also deliver. The owners are sweet and attentive and are really interested in their customers. Kathy will chat you up for quite a while if she has a chance. 

The pho' tai ( beef noodle soup ) is a dish I could eat everyday, especially in the winter (and cool summer nights in SF). The broth is the best in the city and the portions are decent. The beef they use for the dish is good quality. The barbeque pork rolls are excellent with the dipping fish sauce and the garlic noodles are awesome.
author: Red W.

description: So so glad that Lotus Garden has re-opened. The decor is a bit fancier looking now, the owner is still spunky and nice, and the food is still perfect. this place is a total hidden gem - i don't think i've ever had a bad meal here. i'm so relieved that the closure was temporary!
author: Lily S.

description:
Things that rock:  

Shaking Beef
Steamed Sea Bass
Garlic Noodles
Friendly Service

One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants.
author: Mary S.

description:
3rd time there tonight. Awesome. The owner, Kathy, could not be any nicer, more welcoming and sweet. She's easy going, chatty and fun. She even gave me a hug on my way out! Bonus!!! 

I drove all the way across town in the mist and fog and it was worth the hassle. 

We had the chicken noodle soup (Pho) and I asked for the veggies to be added. Delicate, pure, clean, well-balanced flavors, fresh ingredients. So healthy! 

Best cold medicine in the city! 

The servers were all  sweet, accomodating and polite. 

The room is simple and nicely appointed. The wood tables are lovely, the colors in the room harmonious. Not too fancy but so homey and relaxing.
author: F M.

description: Service SUCKS!  I ordered for delivery with a very impatient person on the other end.  After rushing me through my order I waited over 2 hours.  When I called to ask about the order the woman on phone yelled at me and said the driver was on his way.  About 20 minutes later I get a call back from the same rude lady who says I never answered the door to the driver.  After arguing back and forth telling her the driver never came and repeating my address over and over she finally realized the driver went to the wrong address.  No apology what so ever!  She just asked if i still wanted the delivery.  Starving, I had no option but to say yes.  I was hostage to my hungry belly and extremely rude staff!  Please stay away!!!!
author: Lunagial M.

description:
I always get take out from this restaurant because first, I live across the street and second, the food is really good.  I love their bbq pork with vermicelli and fried banana with coconut ice cream and vietnamese sandwiches! But I also like many of the other dishes but I can't remember the names.  I haven't had a bad dish from this place yet.  

I'm taking out one star because one random night, I brought my family in to have dessert and they told us that we could only have dessert if we ate dinner there.  Fortunately, I spoke to Kathy, and she accomodated my party.  

If you are craving for simple vietnamese food that is good, come here!  Parking my be difficult bc it is in the mission...
author: Diana G.

description: Great local vietnamese place. I go by there to pick up dinner for home. The Pho Ga is excellent.
author: Raymond H.

description:
The Hot and Spicy Vegetarian soup has pineapples, tofu, lotus root, red hot peppers, bamboo shoots, and is just so yummy!  I came down with a yucky chest cold a couple days ago, and I ordered this soup yesterday and again today ... it's just the thing! Move over Chicken Noodle Soup, HELLO Lotus Garden Hot and Spicy! Yesterday I also ordered the regular vegetarian soup, and that was very hearty and comforting, too!

The interior of the restaurant is kind of dark, and the aquarium full of live crabs makes me sad ... the dismal interior is the main reason why I haven't gone here more in the past ... but the people working there have always been sweet and courteous ... I think from now on, I'll get the food to go, or delivered, since it really is yummy!  They have quite a few choices in the vegetarian section of the menu.
author: Rachel D.

description: Went here today.  It is nice to have a Vietnamese Restaurant in the area.  This place is cleaner than others in the Mission, but more expensive as well.  Our party had the pho ga, the combination pho, a vegetarian banh xeo (pancake) and a clay pot.  The pho soups tasted clean, the pancake was excellently done, and the clay pot was meh.  You have to ask for hoisin and sriracha if you order pho.  Altogether, a pleasant experience - I would go again, since it is close by.
author: Go S.

description:
Meh. Not bad, not great. 

Soggy noodles. So-So broth. And expensive by Pho-standards. You'll find much better options in the Tenderloin.
author: ciara s.

description:
Have been in the neighborhood for many years, and our family ordered a lot delivery from Lotus Garden. The food is very good and we have never experienced any problem with them. They're always repeat my order to prevent mistaking happen for any reason.
Surprisingly, I just read a review of a man who got food poisoning on THE NEXT DAY after eating pho! I mean, common, if you got food poison because of eating pho, you got it right away. And if it's dirty, our family at least had once 'coz we had eaten here for so long ... 
anw, he might just get st wrong with his stomach and say so ... I hope it will not hurt the Lotus Garden's business because we were so happy to see they reopened ...
author: Nam N.

description: yum yum yum....it's a dark and rainy night  (thanks Snoopy) and I'm craving vietnamese food.  Was a little concerned when we called in the order as it took a really long time to spell a neighborhood street...but food arrived in 40 minutes, was delicious, fresh, and totally awesome.  THANK YOU!!!
author: cheryl h.

description: I ordered two dishes there,one is sautéed prawns with mixed vegs over rice ,which is very bland ,basically no flavor except salty. The other is deep fried spring rolls ,dried up n tough ......
author: B J.

description: I've never had pho that I didn't like... until now. I paid about $15 for a vegetable pho and a thai iced tea. If it were amazing then i wouldn't be too mad about the price, but it was decent at best. The portion was tiny and it tasted like it had been sitting out for a few hours. Usually when I get pho, it is two meals. This was more like a snack. I'm never going back.
author: Jones E.

description: Great food! Loved the Pho! Owner is very nice and cares about the restaurant.
author: Marvin P.

description: It's decent but not great. The lady that owns the place has an attitude.
author: Mojo M.

description:
Too much money for too little food.

I don't usually have Vietnamese food delivered but I felt like trying something different tonight. I found Lotus Garden on yelp, another one for my overrated on yelp file, and thought I'd give them a try.

I ordered the Raw beef salad for 8.95 and the Garlic Noodles with shrimp for 8.50

They estimated that it would take 35 minutes and they were right almost to the minute. I heard the doorbell and opened the door to see that for some inexplicable reason the delivery guy put the bag of food on the ground. Right on the steps of my building where I hose off used condoms and vomit. I was not amused.

The raw beef salad was kind of bland until I put some of the fish sauce on it, then it tasted like fish sauce. Over all it was a very small salad but even so it was mostly cilantro and cucumbers. For $9 I expected a bit a lot more beef. The Garlic noodles with shrimp had no shrimp, not even one. I was noodley and garlicky, it was tasty but a small portion for $8.50? Give me a break!
author: Manny F.

description:
I'll give this 2 stars since the fried veggie egg rolls were flavorful and the soup decent. But the so-called Garlic Noodles are really just overcooked linguine that taste like old butter. And the chicken w/ mixed vegetables was mediocre at best w/ chicken that tasted a bit old (not spoiled, just not the best quality or freshness). 

Definitely wouldn't suggest ordering from here & surprised that the rating is so high.
author: Rini R.

description:
initially this place felt like a notch above your regular vietnamese joint. a bit nicer, a bit more diverse menu.

also on this sunday night nobody was in the place but a kid coloring in a coloring book with 1/2 a bowl of soup.

service was nice, and we had to ask for the pho menu as it wasn't included on the dinner menu.  pho was good.
author: Ameer N.

description: A fire next door forced Lotus Garden to close :(  I hold hope of it reopening in the future!
author: Melissa C.

description:
I was shocked to see that vegetarian pho here is $8.95. I've NEVER paid that much for pho anywhere. 
Yes, the service is great and they are really nice.
the veggie pho was good...but it wasn't great.
author: Nadya K.

description: The food here is amazing! Everything is always fresh and the owners are a delightful sight to see! It's extremely difficult to find a Pho place that doesn't have a ton of MSG and hasn't been sitting in a pot all day. I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Fernando R.

description: GREAT FOR VEGETARIANS AND VEGANS!!! That's why I'm handing out 5 stars. Vegan friendly Vietnamese places are so hard to come by.  Even when they have "vegetarian" options they still use chicken broth, oyster sauce, or fish sauce. This gives me major sad face.  This place, on the other hand, is totally great about making my order vegan. I have started eating here every week with my boyfriend for date night (he is not a vegan) and we both love it. It's very casual, but the service is always fantastic. Definitely one of my favorite neighborhood joints.
author: Mathew d.

description:
I had the Pho today. I was pleasantly surprised. Better than I expected. It's not like restaurants that are Pho specific though, as they only brought out bay leaves, sprouts, and jalapenos. No sauces, not Sirachi. I suppose I probably could have asked for some however, so it I share the blame. Also had spring rolls. I like spring rolls, and these did the job. The person I was with like their meal very much too. It was more of an entree, and I don't remember what it was. 

Interesting how few tables were full at 1pm on a Tuesday, but maybe Tuesday's aren't great restaurant days in Bernal Heights/Mission.
author: doug d.

description:
Without a doubt my favorite place for Pho Ga.  It's not on the dinner menu but if you ask for it they will make it for you.  This is a family run business, which is another reason I love this place.  Kathy is super friendly, has an amazing memory for what you ordered last time, and always comes by the table to chit chat with you.  Her husband cooks, and if it's a weeknight, you will usually see one or both of her sons sitting at a corner table doing their homework.  So cute!  

Some of my other favorite dishes there are their Lemon Grass Chicken, Shaking Beef, and Coconut Prawns in Clay Pot.  Thank goodness for their delivery service because when I am stuck on the couch not feeling well, I can still get their Pho Ga which always puts me back in action.
author: Amy K.

description:
EDIT 12/2007:  I had to dock them a star; the fried rice and tofu dish I had was just "ok", and that was eating while inebriated!  It can't be that good, can it?  Service remained friendly, despite coming in close to closing.  

Four stars

------------------

They've got a "People Love Us on Yelp" sticker, so they've gotta be good, right?

Lotus Garden's yet another gem when it comes to Vietnamese cuisine--especially for vegetarians, which they are well accommodating of, not even flinching to make a dish sans fish sauce.  The appetizer crepe was excellent.  The curry was good, but I'm anxious to try other dishes.  Portions were suitable to the moderate pricing.    

While not on the menu for dinner, Pho can be ordered, but for a couple dollars more.  Unlike Gabriel's experience, there wasn't any hint of an attitude over it.  In fact, service from start to finish, couldn't have been any better.  

Another hole-in-the-wall looking joint, the interior is clean and uniform.  And the humongous crabs were a treat to watch in the tank, despite us onlookers knowing their fate of eventually being devoured.
author: Marsha Z.

description: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in the City. Food is always fresh & flavorful & a good value. It's a family business & Kathy the owner makes you feel welcome. This family works their butts off so go have a meal there & bring your friends @ family & share the experience. They also do take-out & catering & I'll be booking them for a bunch of events.  Favorite dishes are shaking beef, sea bass with special sauce, & Vietnamese pot stickers (not your ordinary Chinese style, these are much better)
author: Iris F.

description:
Always listen to your trusty Gaysian boyfriends.  ALWAYS.
For instance, when they tell you that you should add some bling to your blah outfit.  LISTEN.  They know.
When they tell you that you're gaining weight and should probably lay off that last bucket of fried chicken.  LISTEN.  They been there.
And when they tell you that the dirtier, the grimier, the Vietnamese joint, the better the food.  LISTEN.  Fo' reals.

We stopped in prior to the recent Yelp Open mic night at Socha.  Across the street, totally convenient and fast.  I like it.
The food on the other hand was borderline flavorless.  My BBQ Pork Bun dish was merely so-so.  And my partners lemongrass chicken was good, but not fabulous.
We deduced that it was because the floors were meticulous, the waitress spoke semi-fluent English and the lobsters & crabs in the "fish" tank were actually ALL alive.  No floaters here.

Though it was all edible and tasted okay...I honestly wouldn't come back here again unless in a pinch.  The food was pricey for the portions and food just wasn't up to par.

Don't forget.  Gaysians.  KNOW.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Lotus Garden is the best Vietnamese East of the line defined by Divisadero/Castro street, which runs South/North (or North to South) through San Francisco. They also do delivery or pick-up if you like to drive.

The customer service is excellent and the gustatory pleasure alike.
author: Bobby T.

description: We go here because it's the only decent Vietnamese restaurant within walking distance from our house. It's always almost empty, which I find not only unsettling but odd, because the food is well worth the price. I usually order the Pho, which is consistently good. Their rice plates could use a little more meat and less rice. Their Bahn Mi sandwiches cost more to eat there than to-go, which makes no kinda sense. Yesterday, a women came in and ordered a Bahn Mi sandwich without onions, and the owner said, "It's no good without green onions. You get it with the onions." The customer folded and got the green onions. Later, when the owner was clearing our table, she asked me if I'd put soy sauce in my pho. I said, "No." She said, "Good. Don't ruin my broth with soy sauce." I know it sounds rude, but it was really funny and endearing, like your crazy aunt who loves you but doesn't act like it.
author: Jay D.

description:
Everything is about $2 more than I'm used to paying for in terms of Vietnamese food, but the food is very clean tasting and fresh.  

We ordered the #20 BBQ Pork and Imperial Rolls w/ Rice Noodles ($6.95) from the lunch menu.

http://www.lotusgardencuisine.com/lunchmenu.php

My rice noodles were snappy, and not gummy at all. It wasn't really Imperial Rolls, but a very thin imperial roll cut up and toss on top of the noodles along with some chopped up peanuts.

The restaurant does give you a good amount of meat.  I had excepted Char Siu as the BBQ pork, but was very happy it wasn't. 

Initially, I had thought that it was skimpy, but it was the right mix of vegetables on the bottom, imperial roll, BBQ pork, and rice noodles to satisfy me in the end.  The imperial roll was gummy... compared to Tu Lan's, it wasn't anything to write home about, but then again, the last time we went to Tu Lan's and had their wonderful imperial rolls, we got sick for two days.

My husband thought it was interesting that the food came out and it wasn't really hot and it wasn't really cold.  I think it was because it was a sort of noodle salad that we ordered.  

I really like the owner though.  She had a great smile and a terrific sense of humor.  We didn't know what to do with the fish sauce and she told us to mix it in with the noodles.  It added quite a bit of delicious zing.  I would never have put that into the noodles if she didn't tell me to--it just looked like egg roll dipping sauce.  It tasted sweet when I dipped the roll in, but mixed into the dish... it was great!  Don't be afraid of the sauce if you didn't have it.

When she came to pick up the dishes, she said, "oh... he didn't like it" and smiled.  She got my husband just right.  He ate everything, and it was funny that she caught on that he was the kind of guy that would say, "oh... it's ok" when he liked something a lot.

Also, I'm glad the owner is so nice.  One woman wanted extra condensed milk added into her drink to make it sweeter, and she went ahead and did that for the woman.  To me, that would be like asking for more cream cheese on my bagel at Noah's. 

I would definitely come here again and with friends.

The site for the restaurant is http://www.lotusgardencuisine.com/index.php
author: Priscilla L.

description:
PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE  go to Lotus Garden!!!  
Not only does it have great food but the owner is so sweet.  Every time I go in there there is not a lot of people.  I want this business to succeed because the food and service is wonderful.  I particularly love their chicken noodle soup and their beef/shrimp spring roll that's done table side.
Try it out, it won't hurt and it's reasonably priced.
author: Tasha S.

description: Moved to the neighborhood recently and have eaten here a few times.  I love their chicken pho, especially when you get it to go, because it comes with a yummy brown sauce to mix in there.  I have also had the spring rolls, imperial rolls, and bun noodle salad, which were totally decent but nothing to write home about.  The owners are extremely nice to us every time we come in and the service is very fast.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I discovered this gem about 2 months ago and have been revisiting for lunch atleast once a week.   The owner and her husband are super friendly.  I felt like i was walking into an aunt's home each time.  Their bun leo is delish!  I am hooked!  Its the first viet restaurant I know that even serves that rice noodle soup.  For you coconut lovers, you have to try the fresh coconut juice straight out of the coconut shell!  The shredded cabbage salad with shrimp is also one of my favs.  I never found parking to be an issue; perhaps i just got lucky?

Update:  I took an out of town friend for dinner here a few weeks ago and she was truly impressed!  Actually, I was as well.  The restaurant is transformed into a more sophisticated dining venue for dinner time. For entertainment purposes, make sure you ask for the flaming beef entre prepared at your table.  I forget what its called exactly but it was different.  There is a whole separate dinner menu that has many interesting options;  Would definately try to go there for dinner more often.  Sorry I can't get into the specific dishes I ordered that evening;  Its been almost a month and my memory has been slush lately =P

But check it out for yourself; you won't be disappointed.
author: Amanda A.

description:
By far the best and cleanest Pho I've eaten here in San Francisco.  

The owner is very nice and personable, and the service is excellent.

I've tried several other dished during dinner, and although I felt that there were more vegetables in the meat dishes than meat, I found them to be all done well.  The Garlic Noodles are also great here.

The only other gripe I have is the location.
author: Yoonsang Y.

description: To me, it's Tu Lan without the "dive bar" feel. Great pho here although they charged me an extra $2.00 since it was "dinner time". Noodles were excellent and they put a good amount of beef in there too. It would've been about $6 just for the pho if it wasn't dinner time, but I'm not complaining.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Kinda out in the cuts (bernal heights) but definitely a nice area.  Good food and even better service.  Has a nice family owned vibe.  

My boyfriend and I had the beef carpaccio which was served on shrimp chips (first time having it on shrimp chips).  It was cool because the acid from the carpaccio made the shrimp chips made a sizzling sound.  We also had the grilled shrimp which was grilled right next to our table and then you wrap it in rice paper with lettuce, carrots, onions, cilantro, mint leaves.  We also had the five spice chicken which was tasty but less adventurous.  

The owner, Kathy, is really sweet and makes good conversation.  I bet this place would make a killing if only it was in the sunset~  It's all about location location location.  Anyway, if your ever in the neighborhood you should stop by.  

Only complaint, they should have pho during dinner time.  Pretty much because I say so and because I can eat pho any time of the day.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Healthy, fresh, impeccable ingredients, super dishes, super service, GREAT!  A must-try.

We have eaten here now four or five times.  While we are vegetarians, we have "wandered" and have sampled, for instance, the amazing grilled prawns (they grill them at your table, and you wrap them in rice paper and lettuce with mint and various other stuff and it's GOOD).  

YUMMY FOOD.   Reasonable prices.  Never any worries about getting a table, etc.  

We are "foodie" types, and this spot is now one of our staples.  

For veggies: everything we've tried has been super.  Try the lemongras tofu dish, if you like spicy.  Or the sauteed tofu and vegetables....  Or the wonderul crepe.

We wanted to rescue one of the crabs.  It kept looking at us.
author: Mark C.

description:
My GF had the beginnings of a horrible cold and she wanted soup--STAT!  Well we found Lotus Garden on Yelp which is right around the corner from our home--I have walked by at least a hundred times. I guess I was always focused on Blue Plate!

We ordered Imperial rolls, Chicken and Mixed Veggie soup; Shaking Beef; Pan fried noodles with Chicken. I walked over a little early to have a Vietnamese beer--Hue, and our order was ready in 15 minutes. 

Everything was very tasty and fresh. I chatted up the owner, Kathy, and she was delightful and she is very in touch with her customers. I would highly recommend eating there.
author: Deborah S.

description:
Went here for the first time a few days ago and ordered our regular dishes when we go for vietnamese - vermicelli w/ eggroll and bbq pork, and the roll your own eggroll with bbq pork.

The food was good, but the portions were a lot smaller than we are used to getting from our regular restaurant we go to in the mission - called Evergreen.  One eggroll instead of two, and a lot less meat.  So basically you get less and pay more.

The place is full and busy ....so you know the food is good.  Ashame they just don't give a wee bit more on the portions for the prices you pay.  Otherwise, we'd go here again since it's a lot closer to us then Evergreen. 

Might try this place again, but not for take out.  Next time we'll sit in the restaurant - may be it will be better.
author: Gina C.

description:
So, THIS was the place that got me to actually create a Yelp profile.

Looking for a good Vietnamese place that delivered close to our Glen Park home, my wife and I went to Yelp and found the Lotus Garden shining with 4 stars, and so gave it a try.

We ordered one of our favorites, Xao Lam with Chicken, plus garlic noodles with prawns and an appetizer of vegetarian spring rolls.  I also ordered a thai iced tea for myself.

Food arrived about 40 mins later as promised... but right away I saw the Xao Lam was unlike any interpretation I'd ever had before.  The sauce was watery, there were no vermicelli noodles in it (which is pretty much standard), and it was just plain dull.  The spring rolls were pretty good, served with sweet soy... but the garlic noodles were conspicuously prawn-less, and I also had no iced tea.
(Which also brings up the continuing dilemma of wanting to verify that the order delivered to you is correct, but also not wanting to make the delivery guy wait uncomfortably on your doorstep while you do so).

So I called them back, and a very friendly (and apologetic) woman told me the driver had picked up the wrong noodles, and he would be back with the correct noodles and my iced tea.
Well, the prawn-less noodles were pretty good mixed with the dull Ga Xao Lam plus a bit of added Sriracha (saves practically ANY boring Asian meal), so that seemed like a pretty decent resolution.  More garlic noodles... with the missing prawns... would make a good next-day meal.
So we ate what we had, and had just finished when the delivery guy came back, bearing my tea... and prawns.

No noodles, just prawns.

So... uhhhhh...   Hmmmm.   I guess I'll just pop these in the fridge.

*shrug*

Did I mention that our dinner came to a whopping $40 including a modest tip to the driver?

We may try them again, as EVERY place deserves a second try, but it won't be anytime soon.
author: Greg R.

description:
** Delivery review only **

We ordered a delivery from Lotus Garden and when I looked at the bill they tacked on a surcharge to deliver the food - I think it was something like 20%. We had tipped the delivery guy anyway, so where does that money go? Is there some reason it's more expensive for Lotus Garden to deliver food in a brown paper bag than to have someone eat in their dining room?

And the food was just OK ... already a little on the expensive side for Vietnamese.

Anyway, not cool Lotus Garden - won't be ordering from you again.
author: Bart C.

description:
Good Vietnamese dishes, but service is mediocre. I'll start with the bad and end with the good. 
1) Seating us near the door with the wind draft, but eventually got to move after another party left.
2) Slow service, perhaps due to the larger party of 20, but still. 
3) Pouring out our own soup, forgetting a drink order
Perhaps, I went on an off nite, but I got to tell it like it is...Dishes that made up for it:
1) Vietnamese Crepe-Banh Xeo
2) Crab Meat and Asparagus Soup
3) Five Spice Chicken
author: Jeanette W.

description: Not only is the best vegetarian/vegan pho that i have ever had - it just might just be the best soup i have ever had - the wait staff is nice, kathy is a rockstar and the place looks great since they reopened after the fire next door. this is one my favorite places to eat in sf and even my friends who are not veggie order the vegetarian pho ... love it !!
author: Ramona C.

description:
went back again to give it another try and my original review still stands.

The food is average and slightly overpriced (especially given the location).  The Dragon Lady owner tries to nickel and dime you with extra charges and rules the roost with a iron fist.  Alot of reviewers seem to think she is friendly and nice, but they cannot understand what she is saying to the staff. 

Would only recommend if you have a strong hanerking for VN food and live around the block.

=======================================================


This is a decent vietnamese place, but overpriced with smallish portions and a cold (temperature) environment.    The restaurant used to be right up the street past the Safeway, but went out of business for lack of customers.

If you are craving pho or other Vietnamese food and do not want to drive more than 2-3 miles from Noe or Bernal, then this place is OK.  Otherwise skip it and go to Clement Street or 20th and Irving.
author: Zk K.

description: Lotus Garden is OPEN!  Just had a very tasty Vietnamese sandwich :-) Please go back and support this great neighborhood restaurant.
author: Jax L.

description:
You'll find Lotus Garden to be an understated, even plain, restaurant with good food at good prices. The owner is friendly, if perhaps slightly jaded, and has clearly been cooking for a long time. We enjoyed the spectacle of prawns being cooked right at our tableside, and we watched a dish served to the table next door be engulfed in flames (intentionally). That's more theater than we're used to with our meals. I also zoned out watching the crabs move around the tank in the back, vainly trying to escape.

I remembered reading that the Vietnamese crepe was good, and it was tasty enough, if not entirely my cup of tea -- I just don't love bean sprouts (with which the dish was filled) that much. Better were the previously mentioned shrimps, which we wrapped in rice paper  with lettuce, cucumbers, carrot, mint, and basil. Our final two dishes, the lemongrass chicken with green beans and the eggplant in coconut curry sauce, were exquisitely flavored, with complex spicing we couldn't hope to achieve at home. The chicken was tender, and the eggplant was smoky. Unfortunately, there was a surplus of onions and peppers, which I don't care to eat, but they did add flavor.
author: Tara M.

description:
I was well on my way to writing an adorable review of this place, but my computer crashed and now I'm tired, so suck it.

They deliver.  They are friendly.  The food is nom-licious.  For further information, please refer to the other reviews.  They're right there!  Quit being lazy.  That's my job.
author: Coco D.

description:
This place is good.  Oh, I'm a little drunk right now, too.  Hmmm.

While the decor is a little bland, this is instantly made up for by the coolness and personality of the waitstaff.  They helped us pick out some really great entrees and even told us all the the history of Brew 33 and it's connection to the French Colonial history in Viet Nam.  Totally cool!  They also recommended that we try Hue beer, which is even more delicious than Brew 33!  Allright!

We went for a big Christmas Eve dinner and got a whole crab, which was delicious and properly prepared, succulent and tender.  This was complemented by the crab and corn soup which was very, very good.  Also, the special shrimp and sugarcane with mint leaves made me glad I am no longer vegetarian, and our server so courteously helped show us how to eat them, instead of just laughing at us trying to eat the sugarcane...!  Ha, it would have been funny, though!

The pan friend catfish with ginger sauce was decent, but nothing to write home about, as was the shaking beef.  The steamed green veggies we ordered, yeah--we awesome.

And to top it all off, we got a fried banana and friend ice cream. Totally awesome dessert and a great Christmas Eve.  Thanks, Lotus Garden!

You should be more busy than you say you are!
author: Ben V.

description: My first time to this place - and had a wonderful experience. The manager/hostess was so sweet. She knew all about Gluten Free options and was very helpful in helping me pick the right dishes. The food was great. Definitely coming back here again!!
author: N C.

description:
This place has three redeeming features:
1. The extremely friendly owner,
2. The general unpretentiousness, 
3. The fact that it's kid-friendly.

I went there with my disastrous two year old, who tends to destroy restaurants with demonic zeal, and they made it incredibly easy for us. They even had a plastic plate and drinking cup for my kid. We were ecstatic about the service. 
As for the food:
My wife had a particularly tasty grilled beef dish. My chicken soup was not very good. But I'd like to try more of their traditional Vietnamese  dishes before I pass judgment. If you are looking for a traditional pho place, this isn't it.
author: Billy Ray V.

description: this place is great. the lady who runs it is funny. intentionally funny. it sits all unassuming in a very competitive neighborhood and business hasn't been the same since the fire, but its quality of food doesn't seem to drop any. they take great pride in their food and serve it very seriously, and all the friends I've brought there have had nice things to say about it. Try their shaking beef. Do their beef pho. Do it!
author: Pete L.

description:
OK, we went to Lotus Garden today based on this post from Chowhound:

http://www.chowhound.com/topics/348214

I am so glad we did.  We ordered all three crab dishes; on the menu they show two crab dishes - the roast crab, the crab in black bean sauce, and the third dish isn't on the menu - the owner called it  "the third secret crab" - it's crab in coconut curry sauce.  All were terrific; the crab in black bean and coconut curry sauce have chili in them, so if you don't like spicy food, be aware of this.  The roast crab was my personal favorite of the three, and was just awesome.  We also had the Vietnamese crepe appetizer, which was good.  Service was great, they let us pick our own crab and the woman working there was very friendly and helpful.  After the meal, we got finger bowls with fresh lemon to wash our fingers in.  Highly recommended, especially considering crab season is *now.*

Warning: this dining experience is not cheap.  Total bill for 3 crabs, one appetizer, and three drinks came to $145.
author: Asteridae A.

description:
Being a native from Vietnam, I was really disappointed.  I ordered delivery and was excited that I placed my order in Vietnamese thinking that it would be authentic.  My wife, who is not Asian, thought it was the worst Vietnamese food that she has ever had.  

The imperial rolls were obviously fried earlier and just reheated or refried.  It had a hard middle.

The bbq pork looked like beef jerky.  I couldn't tell the difference between that and the shaken beef that I ordered.  The pork was literally burnt to a crisp.  Very disappointing.  The only positive of this dish was the fact that they fish sauce was well seasoned.

I also ordered the vegetarian noodles.  It looks like they took top ramen and just threw some steamed veggies on it.  

The saving grace of this place was the shaken beef.  Tender with plenty of grilled onions.  Not the best, but the best of what I ordered.  

Don't ever go here.  My bill was $50 !!!  I would rather drive to SJ and get more authentic Vietnamese than going this place where they are lazy and pretty much all they do is reheat the food.
author: Steve L.

description:
We ate here for the first time last night. The waitress, who I guess is also the owner, was very sweet. We were on our way to the opera and they were able to get us fed in time. The place was very clean.

We had the imperial rolls, coconut prawns in claypot, and eggplant in garlic sauce. The sauces were very good and importantly, everything was very fresh. I will definitely be back to try other dishes. We also tried the guanabana shake, which was delicious! It's made from a fruit that has a creamy banana/papaya/citrus taste (hard to explain!). We felt very good after this meal.

I find it very bizarre that reviewers are complaining about the 'cooking at the table' dishes because they don't want the show -- but they still order the dishes. Just ask for them to be cooked in the kitchen! Geez. How hard is that?

Finally, I totally disagree with the reviewer who prefers to go to Jasmine Tea House across the street. The food is fine but I always feel ill after I eat there. It's a Chinese dive, with the correlated quality of a dive-- unlike Lotus Garden.
author: Marina N.

description: I came here with a group of 6 people on Friday night, there was hardly anyone there so we were seated immediately. They have a tank full of crabs, so if that's your thing you can get it fresh here. I got the bbq pork and shared pot stickers (the Vietnamese kind are more of a rice ball) with a friend and both were very good. I wouldn't say this place is great but I enjoyed my food and would eat here again. The prices were reasonable and it's easy to get a table for a big group. They take credit cards which is a bonus, but if you do have a group ask them to split up the check otherwise the bill you get makes no sense at all.
author: Beth D.

description:
I got this delivered on New Years Eve, in the afternoon (for lunch).  Food was decent, though nothing amazing. Portions were not huge, but I'm also used to Tu Lan, which I absolutely love. 

Delivery was quick, but prices were not great.  2 noodle dishes, 1 veggie imperial roll, 1 regular imperial roll, $35.  Overpriced, but not astronomical.  Meh.  Might order again, but not enthusiastic about it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I came here for lunch with my mom, sister, and some friends on a rainy SF afternoon.  The food was great!  I really liked my customized Bun (I got it with just shrimp) and everyone else enjoyed their soups.  One friend even said it was the best Pho she's ever had.  The place is very clean, a sterile feel.  I think the true stand out, though, was the server (I am pretty sure she is the owner).  This woman was so so friendly!  She had overheard our conversation about whether or not to get spring rolls to share, and that my sister and I don't eat the pork filling, so should we get veggie ones and yada yada yada...When she brought out the spring rolls (we had decided to go with pork, and we would just not eat them), she had put two pieces of the veggie kind for us on the plate.  How nice, right?!

Overall: tasty food and great service!
author: micaela r.

description:
First time at this Bernal restaurant.  Subtle and good sweet-and-sour catfish soup, delicious "shaking beef", and very good sauteed vegetables. I plan to stop in again and try other items on their menu.

One service oddity: It was late on a Sunday and there were only two tables occupied in the restaurant. I was by myself and the server tried to seat me at a skinny table against the wall by a door, despite all the empty tables.  You're not going to get a huge dinner rush after nine on a Sunday, so give a guy some elbow room at a larger table please!
author: David W.

description:
I was craving for soup on a cold SF day, so I stopped by for lunch on a week day.  The manager/server who was helping my order was friendly and warm.  She explained to me that during the cooking process, they removed all the fat from the broth, so it's clear.

True to her words, my beef pho was without the oily fat layer.  The broth, noodles, and thin slices of beef were packed with flavor when I make my perfect bites on the spoon.

Very happy to have found a yummy pho option close to home.
author: diana t.

description:
We were on a mission.  We wanted pho.  Specifically the soup.  And we were not disappointed.  The broth was AMAZING.  Seriously.  AMAZING!

My friend didn't even bother eating the chicken or noodles.  The steak in my beef pho was surprisingly good and not fatty or sinewy.
author: Anonymouse C.

description:
I've been feeling under the weather and in need of a big bowl
of steamy soup. Lotus Garden did the trick. I had the chicken noodle
soup: rice noodles, tasty broth, velvety white chicken chunks to which I
added bean sprouts, basil, sliced fresh jalapeno's and a squeeze of 
lemon juice. I could tell that I was healing with a sip of broth and a dash
of hot sauce. 
The service was great and the place was squeaky clean. I can't wait to
go back and try some of the other items on the menu.
author: Cindy J.

description:
I went there for the first time last night, I was looking for a new Pho place closer to my house (usually I go to the sunset district) and decided to check out Yelp for suggestions. 
I was not disappointed.
The pho was delicious, one of the better broths I've found in SF. Very rich and flavorful. I had the rare beef and I loved how the meat was stacked so that you could have a piece of pink meat throughout the meal.
The owner was there and was very friendly and helpful. 
I would definitely go back :)
author: Ginger T.

description: I usually order online but this place doesn't give me that option so I called in. I am greeted with a plain hello. When I try to make an order referring to the online menu, it took a sec to scroll to the right spot at the top. I am reminded I should have written down my order when I begin ordering, again before she switches to another call and then at the end when I'm about to finish my order. She explains I'm making her loose business (apparently she doesn't know how to ask people to hold on the line). It was so incredibly rude and its not like i hadn't decided what I wanted. I was almost going to hang up after being reminded twice i should have written stuff down, but being blamed for making her loose money was the last straw. Successful restaurants deal with logistics problems all the time. None of them ever make it a point to blame the customer. The last thing I'm looking for is to be guilt tripped and treated like I'm an inconvenience when there's plenty of other places happy to take my orders and money gracefully. I'm a pretty consistent repeat customer and I order out frequently. Good job on the first impression. You just lost my business permanently.
author: Roxanne Q.

description: Love this place.  Food is great - had the Pho Ga and beef pho - crackin.  I ordered garlic rice noodles with prawn... I would eat this every day if I could.  The restaurant is clean, staff friendly and attentive, and they deliver!
author: Lea R.

description: I really want everyone to know about this place that one could easily pass-on-by. It's delicious! It's crazy nutritious. The service is super duper friendly. Best of all, they have some of the most tasty VEGAN Pho around. How she wrangles that much flavor out of veggies into a perfectly heavenly clear broth is a mystery. Every time we go here it seems woefully slow. In these tough times, let's support the good guys!
author: Grace J.

description:
I love Lotus Garden.  The owner knows us by name, because that is just the kind of customer service they have.  It is the perfect place for big groups that want to eat good, affordable, food AND be able to hear each other over the dinner table.  My FAVORITE dish is the raw beef on cracker thing...I don't know what its real name is but it is delish.  Who would think raw beef could be that good?  You are in for a tasty surprise. 

Final point - apparently someone hasn't been happy with their delivery service...which I guess happens, but from my experience, their delivery service is awesome.  Prompt, hot, delicious.  It is what I order when I need a quiet night at home, like last night. :)
author: Mimi Z.

description:
We were in the neighborhood.  Both me and the wife were hungry.  We hadn't eaten breakfast that morning and it was around 1 o'clock in the afternoon.  We got takeout.  Specifically the Pork rolls and the 5 spice chicken combination.

The pork rolls were average nothing to write home about.  The 5 spice chicken was average and not even close to the quality that you'll find at Cordon Bleu on California St.  However the soup that we had was tasty sour spicy and delicious which is the only reason that this place is getting 3 stars.  

It is also incredibly expensive for a Vietnamese restaurant in the city.  Compared to Anh Hong or Turtle Tower in the TL this place is just decent.  An appetizer and the Lunch Combo cost us 20 bucks with tax.  You can pick up a comparable meal in the TL, or as it were "Little Saigon" for about half the price, which is annoying to me since the food was not spectacular.  Probably wouldn't go back even if I was in the area.  In retrospect I could have gone to the TL which is only about 15 minutes away.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
VERY RUDE. Food isn't that good.....
If you don't want any problems with them, just remember that they are always right and the customer is always wrong!

I have ordered delivery a number of times. The best thing has been the chicken pho. Tonight I ordered the garlic noodles with shrimp. I asked to add veggies and was told it would be $1.50 extra, I said ok. I also ordered the fried vegetarian  rolls. When I got my food I found they gave me fresh spring rolls, which I don't like and the veggies for  $1.50 consisted of one broccoli flowerette, some anemic cabbage, 2 pieces of carrot - no joke. Wow. I called them and told the woman she made a mistake with my order - that I had ordered the fried rolls. Rather than apologize for the mix up, she started arguing with me that I made the mistake! That I ordered the fresh rolls. I said no - I read it straight from the menu. It went on like this for far too long - the woman insisting she didn't make a mistake and I did .Unbelievable. She was more interested in making it clear that she never makes mistakes , then correcting my order or apologizing for the mix up. It was very ugly. To top it off, when we finally agreed that they would deliver what I actually ordered,( and I would hand back the unwanted fresh rolls), -  she had to call me back and let me know that even though what I ordered was a dollar more than what they had charged me ( for an item I didn't order), they wouldn't charge me the extra dollar!  Wow. Gee, thanks.  Guess what? I won't be ordering from Lotus Garden any longer. They're not that good and certainly not worth such RUDE treatment. 
.
author: W L.

description:
I was dead tired and wanted comfort phood delivered (get it, pho, phood, haha, I am seriously this funny in person too) and Yelp came to the rescue with its reviews on this place!

The pho they delivered traveled well and the lemongrass chicken we ordered was tasty too.

Pricing seemed on the higher side and a bit nebulous, as we didn't get the bill. I look forward to eating in sometime, if nothing else to decipher their pricing method.
author: Priya S.

description:
Very good food, a bit pricey for the ambiance you get but still worth it. They seem to have a problem getting people in and I really think it is because of its look. It looks like cheap a Chinese eatery with cloth napkins and people don't even realize it is an authentic Vietnamese restaurant. Blue Plate is right next door so it attracts all the foot traffic as well as attention.

Shaking Beef and Lotus Garden Chicken are amazing. The staff is super attentive and the owner is the nicest woman. I usually don't like Vietnamese food except for Pho, but this place is the only Vietnamese place I would go to if I have the craving. I'm a pretty tough reviewer and this place deserves a 3 1/2 stars (Which is pretty high for my standard-look at my other reviews) but since I want to see this place stay in business I give it an extra 1/2 star to keep good reviews up.
author: Lo F.

description:
I like the very calm atmosphere of that place. It is very relaxing and not that much restaurants in the city are that quiet. When we went there it was on a Sunday night and only one table was took up. But I guess that even if the place got more crowded, the atmosphere should remain the same...

I've tried the Eggplant with Garlic sauce and the vegetable was very tender and fresh. It come very well along with some steamed rice on the side.

The service is definitely very friendly and price are good for the quality of food you will get.
author: Cedric L.

description: My brother and I had a really good experience here, so not sure why some people rate this place poorly.  Maybe because we were the only Vietnamese people in there, it was awkward to have a restaurant full of white people stare at us when we walked in, but whatever.  I ordered so much food and we had really good service and the food was yummy.  I spoke to them in Vietnamese the whole time, so maybe that won us points.  I dunno, but I ordered a Vietnamese dessert (che ba mau) and that was really good too.  We killed all of our food, which doesn't happen often since I'm really skinny, but I was pretty darn hungry that day and the food definitely hit the spot!
author: Quynh D.

description: Ordered delivery tonight, the panned fried noodles were subpar basically it was a bunch of tangled noodles in a big clump a few veggies and chicken which had no life-force left in it. The spring rolls were not included in the delivery (honest mistake but sucks nonetheless). Overall the food was okay, but not great. I recommend eating at the restaurants instead of doing delivery, unimpressed.
author: Michael S.

description:
My friends and I went here on recommendation of the Guardian "Best of" They weren't wrong. The interior has simple lines but unlike other Asian restaurants you can sense the cleanliness of the place. The owner Kathy is a sweetheart. The best dishes are 'raw beef salad', 'imperial rolls', 'Dungeness crab', and 'shaking beef'.

The lack of ambiance and muzac can be unsettling, but it's nice to be able to converse with your dining partners without straining to hear them. The bathroom is as simple and clean as the dining area, a sink that shines and floor that is disinfected.

Try the "33" beer. A clean rice based beer from Vietnam that is to die for.

Go here, it's a great place for lower mission and/or excelsior.
author: Mark B.

description:
Excellent seafood. Clean fish tanks (I can't eat at the R&G Lounge/fish hospice anymore due to green tanks and half-dead fish). Seasonal local fish/crabs. Neat crepe presentation. Decor a bit "corporate hotel lobby"-ish - a bit too spare. Owner very nice - also sells real estate.

Been here four times since last fall, and haven't been disappointed yet. So, the -1 star is for the decor.
author: Jesse A.

description:
We ate here today at 4pm, which was right before dinner. Nobody was in there, and we sat in the "lunch area", which was fine. The dinner tables had fancy napkins. The owner served us politely. The place is very clean and colorful.

The food was some of the best Vietnamese I've had. The combination plate was really good: soup, BBQ pork, a little salad and rolls with a few veggies and rice. My girlfriend had some seafood soup. It was all very tasty and the service was fine, although the only people there at the time. I will certainly return, probably for dinner with some friends.
author: Kevin D.

description:
I came here for my friends birthday last weekend. By the time our party of 10 arrived we were an hour later than our reserved time and the restaurant took no issue with it.

The word Wonderful would be an understatment. Cathy the owner served us our entire meal. She was super friendly, patient, and a great server. 

Thanks for having us! I will definitely come back here. 

If you need a change of pace from Emmy's or Front Porch you should definitely come here. It's a nice change of scenery.
author: A K.

description:
They have the best chicken and beef broths.  Taste great and almost with grease.   The noodles are great but the beef is a little bit too tough.  
However, they are too pricey for the neighborhood. 10-20% lower will bring them lot more business.   Hopefully, they will open soon.
author: Rich W.

description: Doesn't get better than Lotus Garden! Their Pho is super tasty and well priced, and they always give generous portions. I've eaten here a few times, but usually get take-out. I actually get take out from here at least once a week, because I live and work close by. Their other menu items are super tasty and authentic. They are always super friendly and give great service. I love Lotus Garden!
author: Annie H.

description:
Pros: Good services. Food in general are delicious.  Roast crab are super!!!.

Cons:  This restaurant is little bit more expensive than typical Vietnamese restaurant, and the portion is also smaller. 

Extra cons:  Very difficult to find parking!!!

Would have considered it to 3 stars, but since parking is not the restaurant's fault, and my wife loves that roast crab so much, so 4 stars!
author: Alex D.

description: delicious veggie pho and bun. like really delicious. super friendly staff. not my favorite dining room, so i usually do take out. but eating in is totally fine too. definitely come here if you like vegan vietnamese food...
author: joey e.

description:
yay! re-grand opened! the food is good, the decor is simple and clean, but it was colder inside than out the night we went. we all kept our jackets on.

my entree was the last to arrive and required them to set up a cooking station next to me and make it for me - lemongrass chicken with rice papers. but it was worth the wait (ten minutes? fifteen?) and the lady (i think the owner) was so sweet about it.

looking forward to return trips.
author: Will R.

description:
Thought the food was great and very affordable. They have some good fresh options for those, like me, who shy away from Vietnamese because it can be greasy. I got the pork and shrimp spring rolls and the crab and corn soup, both of which were healthy and delicious. I also got the lemongrass chicken which I thought was just ok. 

My husband got these fried breaded pork balls which were really delicious and looked like little fried sea urchins (order it you will see what I mean). They were really good and worth it.  I would order them and I never order anything deep fried unless I am drunk. He also got shaking beef which was good too. And they have brown rice as an option which is a plus.

Best part of this place is the owner who is a sweetheart, and the fact that they deliver. Worst part is the creepy crabs in the tank staring at me while I ate the crab soup.
author: Lynn G.

description:
Nice. Quiet. Clean. 

I've only been there once and I had the vegetarian pho. Not many places have a good vegetarian pho. I was impressed and I will be back for more.
author: Napalm M.

description:
I don't get out much as a working mom with a toddler so I will admit I may be more disappointed than most when I actually do go out to dinner and it is lackluster.  

Disclaimer aside, I think anyone would've been disappointed with my experience tonight.   With only six people in the whole restaurant, it took 5 minute to get a Diet Coke and the waiter was running around like his pants were on fire (to where, I don't know).  He presented me with spring rolls after 10 minutes although I had ordered imperial rolls.  They tasted fine.

The egglplant with coconut and curry sauce should have one of those huge red peppers next to it.   It was so hot it was unpleasant and the larger eggplant pieces were undercooked and sort of hard.  

Hmm, any other ideas for Vietnamese near Noe Valley?
author: Barbara S.

description:
I love this place mostly because it's close to my house, and the woman who runs it is super sweet.
I love their vegetarian pho (technically, yes I know it doesn't exist), Vietnamese pot stickers & imperial rolls.  The pho is only on the lunch menu, but you can get if for dinner for an extra couple bucks.
It's empty a lot of the time, but don't let that fool you, the food is reliably good.
author: Jessica L.

description: the best damn pho ga in the city. seriously, its lotus garden vs. turtle tower for me. They are head on and have awesome pho ga.
author: Alan M.

description: This is not some hole-in-the-wall restaurant (though it may look that way). It has fantastic bun, great imperial rolls, and excellent service.
author: B G.

description:
I stopped in today for pho and it was just average.

There weren't that many varieties (which makes sense: it's not primarily a pho house) so I ordered the basic beef (pho tai) and a vietnamese coffee.

First of all, I got a lemon instead of a lime.  That was a little odd.  Also, I had to ask for the sauces.

The pho itself was pretty good, but nothing spectacular.  The beef was rare and thinly sliced.  The noodles were fine.  The soup itself didn't seem to have enough going on with it, but perhaps that's because I'm used to ordering pho tai nam which has other meaty goodness inside.  I'm talking about the sort of pho that makes you trawl the bowl over and over looking for any and all tasty bits that remain.  This was not that pho.

I guess I was hoping for more based on the other reviews here.  Oh well.  I'll update this review if I go back for dinner b/c it sounds like that's more the strength of this restaurant.  Someone, please, open a dedicated pho house in this neighborhood!  I will keep you in business.
author: Justin K.

description: Food's OK, but they charge a delivery fee which they don't tell you about, and they're really unclear about it when you try to pin them down.  The woman on the phone said in some cases it's $1.50, sometimes it's $4 or $5.  Which is it?  What does it depend on?  My bill still didn't add up, so I'm being overcharged.  Won't be ordering from here again.
author: Jefferson C.

description:
We use to know Lotus Garden when they were up the street and then they moved.  Only a year ago did we re-discovered  them.
We love their pho, lunch specials and find the service speedy, and courteous.  Their other food is very clean tasting and the only complaint is there is not that much variety.  
The restaurant is also clean and inviting.  This is one of our regulars.
author: Hanuman C.

description: Went here with friends who are veterans of the restaurant and ordered for the group.  Everything I had was great.  My favorites were the Nep Chien (Vietamese Pot Stickers), Ca Kho To (Catfish Clay Pot), Ca Tim Xao Lan (Sauteed Eggplant w/ Coconut and Curry Sauce) and the Kem Chien (Fried Ice Cream) and Vietnamese Coffee for dessert.  The "pot stickers" are more like little balls of fried goodness than any pot stickers I've every seen but I'm not complaining.  Kathy, the owner, was great and it was a wonderful dinner.
author: Galen S.

description: Everything here was very good, specificaly the soups.  I actually didn't try the pho, but a sweet and sour shrimp soup with pineapple.  I don't know what I was expecting--something akin to tom tum koong, but this was totally different, in a good way.  Also tried everybody else's food and it was all delicious.  Yay.  Nice to be at a place that serves Vietnamese food other than banh mi and pho.  High three stars.  Also, this was the first time I'd seen Luc loc on a menu that wasn't Cambodian.  neat!
author: Sara L.

description: There were only 4 other people in this restaurant on a Friday night, so that was the first warning sign.  Then, when the food came out, the pho was pretty bland and tasteless.  It almost tasted like the broth had been made from some instant soup mix.  I wanted to like this place, since it's near my house, but I will not be returning.
author: Andrea B.

description: This is our new favorite neighborhood restaurant. Clean, spacious, and the food is good. Affordable. Run by a super nice family. We like to go early with our kids - they are kid-friendly and my kids are always happy with noodles. The BBQ beef noodles are great (not on the menu, but ask). The papaya salad is unfortunately not great, but that's the only thing I haven't enjoyed on the menu.
author: Ren V.

description: The line was busy at my usual place so we ordered from here. The beef pho was very tasty, so were the shrimp spring rolls that came with peanut sauce. we got fried banana and ice cream, delicious. also they delivered quickly.
author: Dana C.

description: The BF and I had dinner here one night and it was pretty tasty. There was only one server and I believe the owner working, but service was great and they are so so nice. We ordered egg rolls, clay pot fish and the shaken beef and all were really good. I've had better shaken beef, but I thought it was pretty good here. The fried rice could have used a little more seasoning, but it had bits of crab in it which was a nice surprise. Will definitely be coming here again.
author: chloe h.

description:
I can't believe you guys give this place 4 stars.  Honestly, when places like CLG get lower scores.  Do you all just like boring, bland food?  Ok, here's why I hate this stupid place.

1. Our order arrived 1 hour after we called.  ONE HOUR.  Which means our food was cold.
2.  Delivery guy didn't know how much change he owed us.  Cowboy had to explain the math. Which, normally I wouldn't hate on, but given the rest of this crap, I'm hating.
3.  What we ordered wasn't quite what was described on the menu.  For example, mixed vegetable coconut curry had no coconut or curry in it. It only tasted like lemongrass.
4.  Our soup had HAIR in it.  
5. We called to get our money back, and explained reasons 1-4, the hair being the final straw.  The witch on the phone proceeded to tell me that it's Vietnamese food and isn't like other food.  Yeah, ok, why describe a curry coconut dish that has no curry or coconut?  She also told me the order arrived very quickly, I guess an hour is quick?  She denied that any hair could have been in the food, but agreed to refund me for the soup with said hair.
6. Dude came to refund our hairy soup (within 10 minutes, quite prompt on that one).  They asked for the food back.  WTF.  We had eaten half the soup by the time we got to the hair.  Then threw the rest down the fucking drain because it's disgusting and tasted of hair and nothing else and you a*holes want it back?  Are you kidding?

In summary, I can't believe anyone eats here.  Even if we hadn't gotten slow service and hairy soup, the food was bad and pretty much tasted like nothing.  Maybe some frozen vegetables.  But mostly nothing.  I hope this spot gets shut down by he health department.
author: Katherine K.

description: While organizing a birthday dinner for a very large party a few twists of fate resulted in a wonderful event at the Lotus Garden. A quick pre-party visit to the restaurant was almost as enjoyable as the party itself. The proprietress sat us down, poured us tall glasses of water and helped us plan our menu. The party went very well and when we started to run low on food the kind staff whipped up a few more dishes for the group to enjoy. The food was excellent - I crave their BBQ-ed pork - and everyone was so accommodating. I can't imagine a better location to have enjoyed a good friend's birthday!
author: Jessa B.

description:
Dinner was at either Lotus Garden or Blue Plate, and as much as I love the pork chops, warm ambiance, and pleasant wine list, I could not deal with a 40 minute wait quoted at Blue Plate. L.G. has received a lot of praise lately on food boards and I was apprehensive that it had perhaps been overrated. Of the three of us, one was a certified onion hater adding to my worries.

My worries were unfounded as Kathy, the petite and bustling owner, provided us with a great meal. I selected banh xeo (Vietnamese crepe $8.50) to start things off b/c neither of the boys had eaten one previously. The rice flour crepe was filled with a mixture of chicken and shrimp and had plenty of fresh, cool lettuce and grassy herbs to assist in bundling up everything into dippable packages. I love banh xeo and would rate Lotus Garden's version slightly below Bodega Bistro's, but still very tasty. 

Bo luc lac (shaking beef) can fetch prices well into the double digit range around town. At $8.95, the juicy cubes of lightly charred beef, garlic, and chile slices were a real windfall. There is something mildly addicting about the accompanying piquant lime juice and pepper drizzled over the tender yet crisped on the edges beef. I would definitely order this dish again. Despite dining companion's allium enmity, he agreed to pick around them when the stir-fried garlic and pepper prawns ($9.50, requested ~spicy~) arrived. The shrimp tasted very fresh and were handled with care. They too had the flavor of a very hot wok but were cooked proficiently. It takes skill to impart a nice char on the exterior surface of meat while leaving the inside moist; I'm not sure who it is, but someone has some skills in the kitchen at Lotus Garden. We also enjoyed chicken with mixed vegetables ($8.50) and there were no leftovers remaining when we finally put down the chopsticks.

A little bit of effort could transform the interior of Lotus Garden into a far more desirable dining destination. The spare white walls and tile floors would feel warmer and more inviting with a small candle on each table, slightly dimmer lighting, and mellow music in the background. Adding a few more options to the wine list and a more enticing ambiance could attract a lot of the overflow from the crowd waiting next door. Overall, 3.5 stars. As of right now, they do deliver but there is a $3 charge, and pho is only served at lunch time.

***********************************************************************
I have gotten delivery and take out a few more times and Lotus Garden continues to please.
author: Candice L.

description: Why is this place virtually empty while the inferior Jasmin Tea House just up the road is packed? OK, Jasmin is Chinese and this is Vietnamese but the food is so much fresher here and not so sweet and greasy as Jasmin. The Pho (as always) is a little salty, but we love the bbq chicken combination plate and the coconut curry prawns. And the owner is super nice. Next time we're going to try the whole garlic crab. This place would get a LOT more business if it offered a delivery service.
author: Andy C.

description: My roommate and I use to order from here atleast once a week and it was always the same order; 2 beef pho's and imperial rolls.  The foods not that great but its good enough for a lazy night when you want to eat in.  Unfortunately, they've been raising the price each time we've ordered and its been frustrating.  Our last order for the three items totaled to $34, and this was the second time it took them 2hrs. to deliver.  When I called to confirm the delivery there was no apology just the cliche, "they'll be there in 10 mins."  Thats a lot of time when you've called to confirm 4 times after the one hour mark.
author: LIVE to E.

description: What a surprise! Great food in an understated dining room. I recommend the Lemon Grass Chicken (spicy) and the Flaming Beef and Prawns (not spicy). Great crunchy potstickers and moist garlic noodles. Great staff and service. This placed has become my favorite for Vietnamese.
author: Monster B.

description: Pho was delicious. I deducted one star for the slow service. Ask for the spicy sauce-- it made a world of difference. This is good, cheap (under $30 for two) food.
author: Andrea R.

description: My girlfriend and I went here when we didn't feel like cooking. She was craving pho, and after looking the Lotus Garden up on Yelp a few people noted it had good pho. After looking at the menu we realized the restaurant didn't even serve pho. We decided to stay anyway. I ordered the five spice chicken with rice, and she ordered the garlic noodles. My chicken was good, but her noodles were sooo garlicky that after we left we both brushed our teeth, watched a movie, and had to repeat the brushing afterwards because we had fuckin' stinkbreath. Also, they charged me an extra $2 for rice without informing me beforehand. The service was great and the tea was tasty....so, I don't know, take it or leave it.
author: Whitney D.

description: This place is very clean and the food is fresh and delicious. A bargain to boot. Their pho rocks. Not on the menu but also available: sandiwiches to go, lunch time only. Great lunch or dinner if you're in the MIssion.
author: Mary J.

description: terrible take out! i don't know about the experience dining in . we got beef pho and a beef/shrimp noodle dish tonight. they made me wait an additional 15 minutes after the 20 minutes they told me over the phone. when i got home (2 minute car ride), our meals were ice cold. the portions were small. my vermicelli dish was all noodles with some small scraps of beef and 4 tiny shrimp. won't be going back. will definitely be making the extra drive to sunflower or jasmine garden.
author: Lindsay M.

description: The food here is consistently excellent, and the service consistently friendly. Recommended: beef and chicken pho, cold rice noodles, roast crab, eggplant with coconut curry, and garlic noodles. Yum!
author: David K.

description: "38 dollas for a small soup and two entree's?! Good lawd that alotta money". The delivery guy just giggles in my agape face and thrusts the receipt at me. Unfortunatly, it wasn't the type of food that improves the quality of your life so for me it wasn't worth the fourty bucks. I signed but I won't be calling again...
author: Emma G.

description: It's amazing how many Vietnamese restaurants I've been to without remembering later that they were Vietnamese restaurants.  I've only been here once, but I really enjoyed my meal.  The decor is your typical San Francisco not-trying-hard-enough-to-do-too-much-with-a-limited-space deal, but overall, it's pleasant.
author: John S.

description: Would go here occasionally because it is the closest Vietnamese food in the hood. The food is ok. Not my favorite for Vietnamese food in SF. They just started to deliver so we were excited about that. They ended up over charging us. We called immediately. They didn't return our call until several hours later. They saw they overcharged and promised to issue a credit on our credit card. Sure enough I got the credit card bill and they never followed through. No credit! It is so frustrating! Who has time to chase this around! Ugh. This is the last time we will eat there. They just lost a regular customer.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I used to work near the Lotus Garden, and a lunch of their vegetarian Pho was a weekly ritual.  Now I have to drive all the way across town for my favorite Pho. . . but it's worth it.
author: Emily C.

description: Ahhh....the comfort that is Pho.  I don't have a great basis for comparison - I've only had pho a handful of times, but so far, this is by far the best I've had.  I've been here multiple times, and I've never been disappointed.  I've tried a couple different soups - beef noodle soup, spicy pork noodle soup, but nothing ever compares to the chicken noodle soup.  Each soup is served with a place full of fresh mint leaves, basil, bean sprouts, and sliced jalapenos.  I'm talking FRESH - like still on the stems, and you can "decorate" your soup to your liking.  The appetizers are good too - most recently I had the pork and shrimp rice noodle rolls - fresh and fabulous.  For fans of Thai iced tea - again, some of the best I've ever had (I've had a lot of Thai tea in my day, so I feel I'm a good judge of Thai tea quality at this point...)  Reasonably priced - for two people, 1 appetizer, 2 huge soups, and drinks (Vietnamese beer and a Thai tea), we are always out the door at around $35 - and we are always FULL.  The seating area is always quiet and spotted with a few tables of people.  The service is WONDERFUL.  Very attentive, yet not annoying - a good balance.  Couple this place with a rainy day or a hangover = heaven.  Another perk - they deliver!  Kudos, Lotus Garden - I'll keep coming back!
author: Jenna C.

description: I simply love this restaurant! The food is nothing short of spectacular.  The food is simple but packed with flavor and aroma in every bite.  There are lots of vietnamese restaurants in the city and i must say Lotus Garden is on the top of my list.  It's a great place for lunch or dinner and is extremely affordable.
