You will not be dissappointed.
author: Aech2 O.

description: I get take out from here about once a month.  I like the lemon grass chicken or pork and the rolls.  It's unfortunate that it doesn't seem as busy as the other restaurants on the street.  It's better than most chinese or other asian restaurants at this price level.
author: Lin N.

description: This place is awesome.  Um, they deliver.  So that means when you're posted up on the couch vibing some tv or nursing a hangover, they'll bring the pho right to you.  I love that about that.  Anyway, aside from enabling my laziness, the food is really yummy.  The pho is suuuuper delicious, it's all about the broth.  I haven't explored much else on the menu since the pho is spot on.  Also worth noting, their customer service is next level.  They didn't include hot sauce on my first order even tho I asked for it when I called it in.  When I asked about it, the sweet lady sent her guy back to my place to give me some hot sauce!  That said, be sure to ask for hoisin & sriracha when you order or they won't include it as they say some people don't like it.  ?  Whatevs, this place is great.
author: Emily T.

description: This is one of mine and my families favorite resturants. The food is always fresh and delicious. The owner is especially friendly and remembers what my kids like to eat. The vegetarian eggrolls and the vegetarian fried rice can't be beat!
author: Dana N.

description:
Food 4; service 5; atmosphere 3

solid food but a little pricey for the portions vs. other vietnamese places.  We ordered the chicken springs rolls - yummy but only 2 for $7?  Also had the special beef pho (good portion size, broth and noodles very tasty) and the bbq pork and imperial roll noodles which were very good although the noodles were too cold.  

Service was very warm and welcoming - she knew all of the other customers by name.  Worth trying if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Stacy N.

description: When I first walked in here the lighting was dark and dismal. The restaurant was completely empty, so I was expecting that the food wouldn't be good either. To my surprise, I found the food to be quite tasty. I ordered some imperial rolls, thit heo nuong, and a cafe su da. Everything was good besides thw coffee. The waitress here was very nice. She treated mw as if I were her own son. Good family oriented restaurant.
author: Cedric F.

description:
not to be a guerrilla reviewer, but i need to bring the average rating of this place down - it's no good. poor quality veggie dishes, no brown rice, no feeling of satisfaction afterwards. the people working there are desperately kind, but that doesn't make food taste much better. 

i usually eat my vietnamese in oakland at pho 84 and its sister ba vo,so i'll admit my standards are high. but seriously, don't walk through the door of lotus garden, go right across the street to jasmine tea house for chinese or up the street to zocalo for pupusas or even down the street to angkor borei for cambodian.
author: Kris P.

description: Pretty good soup broth. Could use more meat and noodles. Quick and friendly.
author: sadie r.

description: I've been here once, good food with reasonable prices and attentive service.  I ordered a noodle dish w/ BBQ Pork and a cut-up Imperial roll on top. Washed down with an Iced Tea.  Tasty all around.  There is  a good deal of little places to eat in this section of the Mission strip, so it may be a while until I eat here again.  But, I definitely would not be against it.
author: TJ D.

description: It's good to have Kathy back in the 'hood. The original Lotus Garden suffered from it's location. I used to go there for lunch  (pho) quite a bit when working at home. I've been going to the new location for dinner regularly (about every other week), and the food is excellent. Kathy's husband is the chef, and he does a great job. The clams in black bean sauce (not always available) is exceptionally tasty (compared to other places where I've ordered similar). If the clams aren't available, order beef with the same sauce - the sauce is amazing. Five spice chicken is prepared very nicely (deboned chicken, great flavor), the shaking beef is excellent. For appetizers, the bahn xeo (as a Vietnamese friend once told me, it could be called a "Saigon Taco") is great, and the Nem Nuong (pork meatballs marinated in spices and fish sauce) is quite tasty. Get the "ba ba" (33) beer, if she has it.
author: Scott M.

description: I ordered delivery from here last night - got the Vietnamese BBQ Pork and the Shaking Beef and two orders of rice.  The total was 25 bucks which didn't seem like very much until the food arrived and I realized that the portions were made for munchkins.  I never eat pork and I accidentally confused the pork for my shaking beef so I ate an entire portion of pork before my bf and I figured out the mistake.  :(
author: Melissa Y.

description: I only started trying this place a few weeks ago, and all I can say is I am beyond thrilled that all of my Vietnamese favorites are available for quick delivery!  Their pho is really, really good (and served, even for delivery, as separate parts that you put together yourself - keeps everything ridiculously fresh!!!) and I also like their bun (vermicelli) dishes.  Their Imperial Rolls remind me of my favorite ever version served at the Elephant Walk in Boston and their BBQ Pork Rolls are also tres yummy!  I haven't explored beyond the staples yet, but I definitely intend to as I have been very impressed.  The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is that it's not over the top - I reserve my 5 star ratings for truly impressive meals.  But, you can't go wrong here... highly recommended!
author: Chris P.

description:
previous reviewer is wrong about their closing. she explained to us [in great detail] about why she was closing. she was looking for a better location as there was a lot of rif raf on the street and not a big walk-by clientele. after being closed about 1.5 years she reopened next door to Blue Plate. apparently she had lined up another location near Dosa in the mission, but the landlord flaked on her and so she reopened on mission. have been going here for years before she closed and am happy to have her back open!

the new place is a bit cold and we mentioned that to her. she gladly took the advice. food is top quality. she doesn't have her aquarium for the salt/pepper crab quite yet, but should soon. highly recommended. we also /really/ like the Luc Lac Beef. it's simple, yet amazing. the coconut shrimp clay pot is also awesome. 

she takes great pride in her food and warms up quickly if you talk to her. she's a little chatter box and very cool. recommended to all.
author: matt n.

description: This review's based on the two things we ordered: chicken pho and the bun with imperial rolls and BBQ pork. Both were excellent and the fish sauce and vermicelli noodles were on point. (P.S. Thanks Mark C. for the tip to order pho before 4 p.m.; the owner told us we were "lucky" we came when we did. It was 3:50.) I'm going to hold off on more stars until we try other dishes.
author: Genevieve R.

description: We love Lotus Garden because the food is excellent and you never have to wait for a table. This is still a hidden gem for great Vietnamese cuisine in SF. If you have the cash to go all out, I recommend the seafood section of the menu - get the whole crab or the pan fried catfish. The other standards like the rolls, Vietnamese coffee, and Vietnamese crepe are wonderful. All the staff, including Kathy the owner, are super-friendly and welcoming.
author: Alissa P.

description: I like this place, everything was served fresh and delicious.  Good pho, salad and imperial rolls.  Everything was served wonderfully
author: Pug P.

description: Love this place because of the pho. Chicken, seafood and beef are all delicious, as well as the bbq pork spring rolls. I usually order for delivery and the only bummer is that it can take 45 minutes sometimes. But always comes with the right order. Great place if you feel like ordering in and live near bernal/mission
author: Maggie K.

description: Awesome!  Simply dining environment but the best crab in town.  Seabass is beautifully prepared.  Try it and say "hi" to owner Cathy.  She'll take care of you.
author: Sean K.

description: Tasty and quick delivery (very friendly both on the phone and in person). The veggie spring rolls were delicious. I think they had mint basil in them. Tofu dishes were spicy.
author: Skip B.

description:
I haven't been there in a long time but had a yearning for some noodles and Lotus Garden is on my way home.  The place is often empty and that makes it less appealing then some other places, but that was my bad because the food was great.  It was fresh and tasty.  The service was very friendly and fast and the prices are not bad.

I am now a little worried that this place is not getting enough business, so give it a try!  I am looking forward to trying out the Pho next time.
author: Marianne J.

description: I just move to the neighborhood and look for vietnamese pho in the neighbor so i went on yelp,i saw a couple review  said lotus garden expensive and the portion are not big. So i skip to go to lotus garden and one day i saw one of my neighbor come over and said hello to me and welcome me to the neighhood.I ask them where is a good restaurant to eat,they told me go to lotus garden. So i went there i order the chicken noodle,they are so clean and fresh. I cant even finish the noodle and my wife cant eat something have wheat on it.The good news they have most of the dish that are gluten free. This is my new favorite restaurant. The portion and the price are Ok, i dont think  they are expesive at all. We have to know everything went up. I went there on tuesday night, now i cant go there anymore because i saw the big fire on the news.I hope lotus garden ok.
author: Justin D.

description: Just ew. The chicken rolls were horrible and expensive. The pho was extremely salty. I took a sip of the soup, gagged, put in some vegetables to try to make it better, sipped again, gagged again, threw the crap out. The only decent part of the meal was the fried banana I ordered to meet the minimum for delivery and that was only tasty for 2 bites before I saw the sheer amount of grease settling on the bottom of the container. Gross. Stupid Pad Thai being closed on Wednesday....
author: Shinigami Y.

description: I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants, but this is by far the best pho beef noodle soup I've ever had.  The soup base is consistently good and made with care.  The deep-fried banana and ice-cream is also fantastic.  The owner is warm and friendly.
author: Melanie T.

description: Just moved to the neighborhood and tried this restaurant given the recommendation from my neighbor. Soooooo glad I did. I am used to Sunflower in the Mission but this was so much better. Really fresh vegees and spices, loved the vietnamese pancake, and the service was so fast and friendly. Clean place too. Happy I live here now!
author: Diana S.

description: I love this place...although it's a tad pricier than other places in the area, Lotus Garden has the best chicken pho in SF. It's not on the dinner menu, but the super friendly owner always makes it for me. The food is always consistent, and the owner is such a sweetheart that she keeps me coming back for more! YUM!!!!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This has been one of my favorite Vietnamese places since they moved back to the neighborhood.  Thier pho, especially the chicken, is so amazing that my boyfriend eats it at least once a week for dinner, much more frequently if I am not already cooking.  It isn't on the dinner menu, as with many higher-end Vietnamese places in town, but they will make it on request for a dollar or two more than it costs at lunch.  I am partial to the bbq pork bun here, and we have a hard time deciding between the vietnamese potstickers (NOTHING like a chinese potsticker) or the combination appetizer platter with bbq pork, shrimp, imperial rolls and rice paper/lettuce/vegetables for rolling.
Seriously, we have eaten that basic meal at least 50 times in the last two years.  But a few weeks ago I finally got the bf to agree to switch the whole thing up.

We got the raw beef salad, which I haven't had there in years.  It was amazing, so clean tasting and delcious.  It was decided that we will have that whenever we eat in the restaurant.  We also had the Vietnamese Crab and it was fantastic.  We had seen it moving around the tank when we got there and 15 minutes or so later, it was on our plate.  The meat from the body is stir friend with ginger and garlic and molded back in, with the legs and small body portions left intact to get the feeling of working for you dinner.  It was amazing and we have vowed to get there again before crab season really ends.  

We will still get our delivery of the standard 'greatest hits' items, but have added it back to the list when we want to get out of the house and eat something that will really excite the palate.
author: M M.

description: So, my boyfriend had been talking about  this little vietnamese restaurant for about 3 weeks now! So we decided to check them out for dinner!!!  First of all, my boyfriend had been raving about there sandwiches and how nice the owner was! He was one hundred percent correct! Not only was the service great but the food was awesome and the owner was a total sweetheart!!  If you happen to be in the area, I highly recommend stoping in for some great vietnamese cuisine and the extra nice service!!!
author: Echo H.

description:
I walked by this place so many times and assumed that it was average - but I was wrong.  Lotus Garden has become one of my very favorite places to eat in SF!

A little secret:  order the vegetarian Pho.  It's not on the menu, but they can make it and it's a rare find.  I used to only get Pho (yummy clear noodle soup) at my favorite place in Seattle because I hadn't found anywhere else that did it justice, but Lotus garden has me hooked.  Make sure you put the basil leaves and lemon into your soup.

They also sometimes have special vegetarian pot stickers which are among the best I've ever had!

If that wasn't enough, the owner will quickly get to know you and remember what you like.  Isn't that what we all dream of?
author: James P.

description: Really good food.  Great place to get soup in the mission for lunch.  Owner is really  nice.  The food and service are always great here.
author: Sarah S.

description: thank goodness this place is here. i'm from a place where vietnamese food is good and plentiful. i'm so happy to have a vietnamese restaurant in the neighborhood. i've had the shaken beef and the pho and both were fresh and delicious. the owner is extremely personable and friendly. they WILL take care of you here. it's like having a slice of home...away from home. support your local family run vietnamese joints!
author: Baroness M.

description: delivery took forever one star off , little pricy for the portions they give , shakin beef was the good beef was tender , lemon ginger chicken was decent , chicken roll average as well , the lady who delivered apologized for the delay which makes it up but sorry still had to mention it
author: NAEL K.

description: why 5 stars?  not because of the price- a bit high for pho, but this is the mission not little Saigon, so adjustments must be made.  not because of the food- well, actually, sort of because of the food, the bun i had was fantastic, the pork was crispy on the edges and tender in the middle- not dry, but perfectly grilled.  the noodles were perfect, the veg mix outstanding and o-so fresh.  the imperial roll was not good, but i never like them, so i don't know what i was thinking.  and not because of the coffee- which i really needed and was really good and strong and sweet and did i say strong and good?  but because of the proprietress.  she was delightful.  she helped me mix my coffee properly and told me the backstory on the restaurant and apologized for the food not being as fast as other places because it was fresh.  thanks for apologizing for having awesome food.  lotus garden, you are my new favorite neighborhood restaurant.
author: Samantha W.

description: i love this place- beef Carpaccio salad is amazing! service is friendly and welcoming
author: emilee y.

description: I used to live walking distance from this neighborhood, and loved to get the pho and raw beef salad at Lotus Garden. That was a couple of years ago. Today, I was feeling under the weather and a craving for Lotus Garden struck. So, I drove over to look for my old haunt and was very sad to discover the restaurant was no more. Then, a miracle happened... I had resigned myself to driving a few blocks up and finding some "consolation meal" of a burrito or burger, grabbed a random parking spot, looked across the road and saw a newer, improved version of the same Lotus Garden! Is it really the same place I wondered?! I went in, to find the same owner, Kathy. Now if you are looking for great Vietnamese food, you can't go wrong with this place. But what really makes Lotus Garden wonderful is that Kathy and her husband (the chef) truly love making their food and serving their customers. Kathy said the new place has been open 16 months now (the old place they lost their lease I believe), but they aren't getting enough traffic to pay the bills. She may need to close if something doesn't change. That's why I'm writing this. Sometimes, you don't want a good thing to be discovered/overrun, but if people don't start going here it will vanish, and that would be a big loss to San Francisco. There aren't enough places with phenomenal food where the owner really cares, and you can feast for less than the cost of a movie. If you go, Kathy will be there, and she will answer your questions with a smile on her face and perhaps tell you about her dream of writing a cookbook. Hopefully she will someday because their food is incredible and we'd all stand to benefit from being able to learn how to make it ourselves.
author: Shoshana D.

description: I didn't think the Pho was that great.  I think every place in the Tenderloin taste better and I also thought the prices were more expensive than other Pho places as well.  It is probably one of the only places you can get Pho in that neighborhood but I still don't know if that's enough to persuade me to go.  They do have good service though, the waiter and the owner seems very nice, which is the only reason I'm not giving it two stars.
author: Andrew S.

description: note: they are only closed until next month! due to a recent fire, they had to temporary close. and i cant wait till i can get more of the best homestyle Vietnamese food ever!
author: Tara S.

description: Everytime I goto a Vietnamese joint, i would order pho, so i decided to try something new.  I decided to give lotus garden a shot after reading all the positive reviews.  We went on a tuesday night and we were the only ones there, which kinda surprised me.  I tried the raw beef salad which was one of the best I had.  Moving on, we had the catfish sweet & sour soup which was rich with flavor, though it wasnt really spicy.  Onto the main course was the lemon grass beef and crab meat fried rice.  The fried rice was kinda dry and it wasnt anything too spectacular but then again, im not a big fan of rice.  I wanted to try the steam clams but they didnt have any.  The owner told us that if we wanted clams next time, we should call and ask about 2 hours ahead and they can accommodate us with clams.  The place is very clean and has nice decor, customer service was great. Price is fair.  Overall I really enjoyed my experience at lotus garden.  I would definitely go back and try other things on the menu.
author: Damon J.

description: This is the best Vietnamese I've had since moving to SF 6 months ago. We've been here twice now, once for lunch and once for dinner. Everything is fresh and prepared with care. The service is attentive and friendly. The bun had just the right mix of herbs, veggies and meat-- the grilled marinated pork was terrific, the noodles just the right level of al dente. The goi cuon had great texture and were definitely made fresh (so many places serve spring rolls that taste like they were made hours ago).  The bo luc lac (shaking beef) was very good, and the muc xao mang (stir-fried squid) was prepared perfectly-- tender and spicy with just the right amount of time in the wok. Couldn't recommend this place more highly. The prices are fine considering the quality.  I don't consider $10 for a heaping plate of deliciously prepared meat to be too expensive. Lunches are all in the $7-9 range. It's definitely value for the money here.
author: Angela M.

description: Well, I probably could've eaten a whole cow all on my own, I was so hungry!  We ordered a beef curry dish and the pan-fried rice noodles with chicken.  Both dishes came quickly and piping hot!  I was really surprised that the pan-fried noodles were so light!  I was expecting a lot more grease, but it was surprisingly easy on the oil and had a much more subtle flavor than the pan-fried noodles you get at other restaurants.  This made me exceedingly happy, as I was about to devour the whole plate!  Both the noodles and the beef dish were tasty, although somewhat unmemorable . . . in other words, they were good, but if my boyfriend didn't live in walking distance, I don't know that I'd think to come back with a group of friends.  Oh also, it was reeeaaalllly quiet in there . . . like you could hear a pin drop and I almost felt like I should whisper or at least keep my voice down.  The servers were really attentive and quick to refill the water glasses.
author: Amy C.

description: We tried the vegetarian spring rolls, chicken vegetable soup, beef eggplant curry and fried banana wth icecream. All was very good but especially the eggplant in the beef curry dish was extremely well cooked. It melted in the mouth. Excellent. The service was very friendly. We definitively plan on coming again!!!  However, parking is a bit tricky in this area....
author: Bettina O.

description: I love the chicken pho here so much!  I mostly go for lunch, but dinner is great too.  The owner is super sweet, the food is fresh and delicious every time.  Oh, and the coffee!  YUM.
author: Erin R.

description: I agree with another reviewer that the restaurant is cold, therefore not cozy but the food and service are both very good.  Everything tasted fresh and well prepared.  And, for me, it's within walking distance.  I don't always want to drive far to eat out.  This place deserves more business.
author: Jennifer F.

description: This is a good, solid Pho place -- nothing spectacular but friendly service and decent eats.
author: Barry S.

description: outstanding beef pho (pho tai). i get it every time. i tried the chicken pho once, but the beef is way better at this place. i think i only ordered something other than pho once. i remember it being good, but there aren't a lot of pho places in the neighborhood, so i always go for the pho.
author: Ben H.

description: didn't want to drive to the TL for some pho. so had to settle. but surprisingly, the pho ga was great. white meat.
author: Diana L.

description: we ordered food in. they had to call me for directions they were half an hour later than they said. the food was fine. we ordered a lot for a feast for 4 and it was just enough, no left overs and it was very expensive. I wouldn't bother going back.
author: ELLIE S.
